0.title: 5-yr-old girl tied up, left on hot roof for not doing homework in Delhi; video surfaces
0.article_body: A video of a five-year-old girl tied up and left on the roof of a house as punishment in Delhi has been widely shared online, leading to an inquiry by the police. The girl was left in the scorching heat for not doing her homework, officials said. The video showed the child screaming and writhing on the roof.

1.title: Didn't want to do Pyaar Ka Punchnama, Rajkummar said, 'Are you mad?': Nushrratt
1.article_body: Nushrratt Bharuccha said after the success of her film 'Love Sex Aur Dhokha' (LSD), she wanted to do films in that genre and had refused to do 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'. "But then I had good co-stars in LSD, Raj (Rajkummar Rao) and Amit (Sial) who said, 'Are you mad? You're being offered a film. It's a big deal'," she added.

2.title: Mumbai sees 1,765 new COVID cases, highest since Jan 25; positivity rate at 9.19%
2.article_body: Mumbai reported 1,765 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, which is the highest since January 25. The city reported a 42% increase in fresh cases in a single day as it reported 1,242 cases on Tuesday. The COVID-19 positivity rate in the city has risen to 9.19%, while zero deaths were reported in the last 24 hours.

3.title: K'taka man kills 17-yr-old daughter over relationship with Dalit boy
3.article_body: A man allegedly strangled his 17-year-old daughter to death for having a relationship with a Dalit boy and surrendered before the police in the Mysuru district of Karnataka on Tuesday. Despite being asked not to, the deceased contacted the boy on Monday, which led to an altercation with her father, following which he strangled her to death, police said.

4.title: Shilpa gifts herself vanity van with yoga deck on her 47th b'day; pics surface
4.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty reportedly gifted herself a new vanity van with a kitchenette, hair wash station, and a yoga deck on her 47th birthday. According to reports, she wanted to ensure that even when she's shooting, she can practice yoga within the comforts of her own vanity van. Several pictures of the vanity van have also surfaced online.

5.title: Chennithala demands Kerala CM's ouster amid gold smuggling scam
5.article_body: Kerala Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala on Wednesday reacted to the allegations levelled against CM Pinarayi Vijayan by Swapna Suresh, the prime accused in the Kerala gold smuggling case, stating the claims made are "unprecedented and shocking". Chennithala also demanded Vijayan's resignation. Suresh has claimed that CM Vijayan, his wife and his daughter were involved in the scam.

6.title: Fringe is BJP's core: Rahul Gandhi amid row over remarks on Prophet
6.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said "fringe" is the BJP's core and highlighted some derogatory statements made by BJP leaders in the past. The post included comments by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who allegedly called Bangladeshi migrants "termites" and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who said that women "are not capable of being left free or independent".

7.title: Shutdown in J&K over social media posts backing BJP's Nupur Sharma
7.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar town observed a shutdown demanding the arrest of three Bharatiya Janata Party and IkkJutt Jammu leaders for their alleged social media posts extending support to BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. The three leaders, according to the protesters, include Ashish Sharma, the BJP's Youth Wing general secretary in J&K and IkkJutt leaders Sparsh Parihar and Anshuman Rathore.

8.title: Pause, take a look: Editors' body to news channels over Kanpur violence
8.article_body: Editors Guild of India on Wednesday said it's disturbed by "irresponsible" conduct of some national news channels after violence broke out in Kanpur. "The EGI demands that these channels pause and take a critical look at what they have done by giving legitimacy to divisive and toxic voices," it said. EGI called for stricter vigilance by broadcasters and journalist bodies.

9.title: Don't fall prey to fraudulent texts on bill payments: BESCOM
9.article_body: Amid Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) consumers getting fraudulent texts of discontinuation of electricity due to non-payment of bills, the company has told its consumers that these texts are fake. BESCOM clarified that it does not insist on payment through text messages. "We have taken cognisance of such fraudulent acts by reporting...to cybercrime police," officials said.

10.title: Orangutan attacks man by pulling his T-shirt & grabbing his leg in Indonesia zoo
10.article_body: A viral video has captured an orangutan attacking a man through its cage. The video, filmed at an Indonesian zoo, shows the ape dragging him closer by first grabbing his T-shirt and then holding one of his legs and refusing to let go. The visitor reportedly broke rules by climbing over the fence separating the orangutan enclosure from zoo visitors.

11.title: Unscientific: India on getting lowest rank on global environment performance index
11.article_body: India has rejected the analysis of the 2022 Environmental Performance Index, which ranked it lowest among 180 countries. "Some of these indicators used for assessing performance are extrapolated and based on...unscientific methods," said the Environment Ministry. Many indicators of the index, devised by Yale and Columbia University researchers, are based on "unfounded assumptions", it said.

12.title: KL Rahul, Kuldeep Yadav ruled out of T20I series against SA; Rishabh Pant named captain
12.article_body: KL Rahul and Kuldeep Yadav have been ruled out of India's T20I series against South Africa owing to injury. The BCCI have named wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant as captain of the side in place of Rahul. Meanwhile, all-rounder Hardik Pandya has been appointed vice-captain for the series. The five-match series will begin on Thursday.

13.title: Latvian national held with cocaine worth ₹69 cr at Mumbai airport
13.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence arrested a 24-year-old Latvian national for alleged possession of 6.9 kg of cocaine worth ₹69 crore at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport, an official said on Wednesday. A DRI official said that the accused was traveling from Brazil and had concealed the contraband material in plastic pouches in a trolley bag.

14.title: 5 injured in blast triggered to dig up a well on riverbed in Pune
14.article_body: At least five people were injured in a blast triggered to dig up a well on the Mula Mutha riverbed in Pune's Kharadi area. Tin roofs of six houses were damaged due to the explosion. None of the injured persons required hospitalisation, police said, adding that one of the persons who triggered the blast had been arrested.

15.title: Cannot cancel liquor vend licence over public sentiment: Delhi HC
15.article_body: Delhi High Court has ruled that a licence issued under the Delhi Excise Act, 2009 cannot be cancelled merely because "public sentiment" is against a liquor vend's location. It said licences can only be cancelled if they fall foul of statutory provisions or violate rules. Public opinion isn't relevant under the Act for locating a liquor vend, the HC added.

16.title: Harmanpreet Kaur appointed India Women ODI captain after Mithali Raj's retirement
16.article_body: After Mithali Raj announced her retirement from international cricket, Harmanpreet Kaur was appointed the captain of the India Women ODI team. The BCCI announced India Women squad for the upcoming tour of Sri Lanka, naming Harmanpreet as captain and Smriti Mandhana as vice-captain. Mithali retired from international cricket after a 23-year-long career.

17.title: Was like 'It's too much': Neena on being offered lot of money for a project
17.article_body: When asked if she's paid well for her work now after facing financial issues for many years, Neena Gupta said, "I've been offered...good money...I...asked my manager how much money I'm getting and I was told this much." "I was like 'nahi yaar, ye...bahut jyada hain, itne kyu maange (no, it's too much, why did you ask for it)'," she added.

18.title: Debt got costlier amid inflation: Congress on RBI's repo rate hike
18.article_body: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala reacted to RBI's repo rate hike stating that the move will negatively impact people. "Today, the repo rate has increased...by 0.50%...People tied with debts will now be forced to deal with increased EMIs. Debt became costlier along with inflation, unemployment and empty pockets," Surjewala said. RBI raised the repo rate by 50 bps to 4.90%.

19.title: Delhi court upholds order discharging Delhi CM, Dy CM in assault case
19.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday upheld a trial court's order giving clean chit to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia in a case of alleged assault on former chief secretary Anshu Prakash. Prakash had alleged that he was called for a meeting at Kejriwal's residence in 2018 and was assaulted by AAP MLAs.

20.title: He was under threat; used to travel with bodyguards: Jose Covaco on Raghu
20.article_body: Jose Covaco, who worked closely with Raghu Ram on MTV's Roadies, recalled how Raghu took the show to another level. In an appearance on The Ranveer Show podcast, Jose said the show was so popular that judges had to be barricaded and would always travel with bodyguards. He added because Raghu had a controversial image, he was constantly under threat.

21.title: Italy arrests 14 Pakistanis linked to 2020 Charlie Hebdo attack
21.article_body: Italy's anti-terrorism police and Europol on Tuesday arrested 14 Pakistanis in Genoa during an anti-terror raid, reports stated. The arrested persons have been accused of having links with Zaheer Hassan Mahmoud, the alleged conspirator of the 2020 Charlie Hebdo attack in Paris. Mahmoud had allegedly attacked two people after Charlie Hebdo republished controversial cartoons of Prophet Muhammad.

22.title: Alarming, eye-opening: US General on Chinese activity near Ladakh
22.article_body: American General Charles A Flynn on Wednesday commented on the buildup of Chinese infrastructure near Ladakh. Flynn, who's on a four-day India visit, said, "The [Chinese] activity level is eye-opening. Some of the infrastructure being created in the PLA's Western Theatre Command is alarming." He said the Chinese must be questioned about their intentions with regard to the infrastructre.

23.title: Iran removes 2 UN watchdog surveillance cameras from nuclear facility
23.article_body: Iran has removed two surveillance cameras of the UN nuclear watchdog International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) from one of its nuclear facilities, state media reported. "Iran cannot be cooperative while...IAEA displays unreasonable behaviour. We hope the agency will come to its senses and respond with cooperation with Iran," Iran's Atomic Energy Organisation spokesman Behrouz Kamalvandi said.

24.title: Hyd teen loses ₹36 lakh received after father's death in gambling
24.article_body: A teenage boy in Hyderabad gambled away ₹36 lakh received as ex-gratia after his father's death. His father was a police officer who had died on duty, after which the ex-gratia amount was deposited into the deceased's wife's account. The police informed the woman that her son was using a mobile gaming platform to place bets with the money.

25.title: 'Hidden world' of marine life discovered under Antarctic ice, pics released
25.article_body: A 'hidden world' of aquatic life has been discovered 500 metres below the ice in Antarctica with shrimp-like creatures in a vast cathedral-like cavern. Scientists from New Zealand found the ecosystem under the Ross ice shelf as they were investigating impact of global warming in a suspected estuary. They captured the organisms after lowering a camera through a drill hole.

26.title: Grant me bail as CBI chargesheet is incomplete: Anil Deshmukh to court
26.article_body: Ex-Maharashtra Minister Anil Deshmukh on Wednesday approached the Mumbai special court for default bail, claiming that the CBI chargesheet filed against him was incomplete. Deshmukh sought bail under Criminal Procedure Code's Section 167(2) which allows the accused to file for bail if chargesheet is not filed within 60-90 days. CBI filed chargesheet without completing investigation, Deshmukh said.

27.title: Rajasthan minister Meghwal gets threat call demanding ₹70 lakh, FIR filed
27.article_body: Rajasthan minister Govind Ram Meghwal on Wednesday said he has received a threat call from a man, who identified himself as a member of the SOPU gang and demanded ₹70 lakh from him. An FIR has been registered in this case, police said. Meghwal is staying at a resort in Udaipur with other Congress MLAs ahead of Rajya Sabha polls.

28.title: Navi Mumbai to add 75 new AC buses to its fleet soon
28.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT), the civic transport wing, will add 75 more air-conditioned buses to its fleet soon. According to an NMMT official, a tender for 25 buses has been floated and 10 buses will be double-decker buses. The remaining tenders will be finalised by the end of the month, officials said.

29.title: 2 Thane history-sheeters arrested, ₹4.35 lakh stolen items seized
29.article_body: The Kopar Khairane Police arrested two history-sheeters for chain snatching and recovered stolen items worth ₹4.35 lakh from them. With their arrest, police claimed to have solved at least five cases of chain snatching in its jurisdiction. The accused were earlier arrested for their involvement in similar cases and after getting bail, they committed another crime, the police said.

30.title: Man held with foreign currency worth ₹2.7 cr at Delhi metro station
30.article_body: The Central Industrial Security Force on Tuesday apprehended a man at the Punjabi Bagh West Metro Station with foreign currencies worth around ₹2.7 crore, an official said. The accused was intercepted around 1:20 pm and informed CISF officials that he was carrying the money for exchange purposes. He was handed over to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for further questioning.

31.title: Will respond to destabilising moves in north Syria: Turkey to Russia
31.article_body: During a phone call on Tuesday, Turkish Defence Minister Hulusi Akar told Russian counterpart Sergei Shoigu that Turkey will respond to moves aimed at disrupting stability in northern Syria. Last month, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that Turkey would soon be launching new military offensives into northern Syria against Kurdish YPG militia, which it considers a terrorist organisation.

32.title: Pre-monsoon work completed in old city limits: Pune civic body
32.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has claimed to have completed all the pre-monsoon work within old city limits and cleaned all manholes, stormwater lines, culverts and other spots prone to waterlogging. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar also held a review meeting on Tuesday to assess the work done to curb flooding. Notably, 76 waterlogging-prone spots identified by PMC have been cleared.

33.title: Over 9,000 trees cut in Bengaluru due to metro project: RTI data
33.article_body: The Namma Metro project in Karnataka's Bengaluru has led to the loss of over 9,000 trees in the city, according to details available under RTI Act. The said number of chopped trees is only related to Purple and Green Lines. The RTI also revealed that BMRCL axed 680 more trees between 2008 and 2019 for other projects in Bengaluru.

34.title: Major fire breaks out at plastic godown in Thane, doused within 3 hours
34.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a plastic godown in Thane's Bhiwandi on Wednesday. No one was injured in the incident as no employee was working there when the fire broke out, but about 1,800-2,200 square feet area of the godown was burnt. Three fire engines were sent to the spot and the fire was controlled within three hours.

35.title: Debt Recovery Tribunal can't restrain person from flying abroad: HC
35.article_body: Debt Recovery Tribunal (DRT) does not have the power to restrain a person from travelling abroad, the Bombay High Court ruled on Tuesday. DRT, however, has the power to prevent abuse of its process or secure ends of its justice, the HC added. The bench was hearing a plea by a 34-year-old businessman restrained by the DRT from flying abroad.

36.title: Raj Kundra returns to Twitter months after quitting, wishes Shilpa on b'day
36.article_body: Months after deleting his social media handles, actress Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra returned to Twitter on Wednesday to wish her on her birthday. "Happy Happy birthday my soulmate...Love you eternally...My wish for you is that you continue...Continue to be who you are, to astonish a mean world with your acts of kindness," he wrote.

37.title: We've nothing to hide: Pawan Khera on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul Gandhi
37.article_body: As ED summoned Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, party leader Pawan Khera said the Congress has nothing to hide. "We're a law-abiding party...So, if they have been summoned, of course, they will go. We have nothing to hide," Khera added. Both the leaders have been summoned by the ED in connection with the National Herald case.

38.title: Video shows Tabu preparing & shooting for Anjulika-Manjulika roles in 'Bhool..'
38.article_body: A video shared by T-Series showed actress Tabu preparing and shooting for her double role of 'Anjulika' and 'Manjulika' in the movie 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. In the video, Tabu can be seen doing horror scenes and flying above ground with help of a harness. In the end, she can be seen wrapping up the shoot by cutting a cake.

39.title: Sundar might get selected ahead of Ashwin: Ravi Shastri on T20 WC
39.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri said all-rounder Washington Sundar might get selected ahead of Ravichandran Ashwin in India's squad for the T20 World Cup 2022, if he is fully fit. "[Sundar] has the ability to bowl in the powerplay, he can also bat down the order and also because of his T20 record," added Shastri.

40.title: Sensex, Nifty fall for fourth straight day as RBI hikes repo rate
40.article_body: Indian stock benchmarks Sensex and Nifty fell for the fourth straight day on Wednesday after RBI raised the repo rate by 50 basis points to 4.90%. While Sensex fell 214.85 points to close at 54,892.49, Nifty fell 60.10 points today to close at 16,356.25. Sensex has fallen 926.28 points while Nifty has fallen 271.25 points in last four trading sessions.

41.title: Over 1,000 surrendered Ukrainian fighters sent to Russia: Report
41.article_body: More than 1,000 Ukrainian fighters who surrendered in Mariupol city have been transferred to Russia for investigation, TASS news agency reported citing a Russian law enforcement source. Kyiv is seeking the handover of all the estimated 2,000 fighters from Mariupol's Azovstal steel plant in a prisoner swap. However, Russian lawmakers have demanded that some soldiers be put on trial.

42.title: 6 employees of liquor contractor cheat owner of ₹6.28 cr in MP, booked
42.article_body: Six employees of a liquor contractor were booked for allegedly cheating the owner of ₹6.28 crore in Indore. According to the police, the complainant said he ran 94 shops in Group B during 2021-22. A few months ago, he learned about the "fraud" in 20 of his shops. He suspected that employees and salesmen were involved in the fraud.

43.title: TN CM Stalin inaugurates 'equality village' in Sivaganga district
43.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday inaugurated the Thanthai Periyar Samathuvapuram (equality village) in the Sivaganga district and handed over the keys to the beneficiaries. Constructed at a cost of ₹3.17 crore, the equality village has about 100 houses. It is built on 12.253 acres of land and has facilities such as playground, ration shop and library.

44.title: Fliers not wearing masks to be treated as unruly, deboarded: DGCA in new norms
44.article_body: Aviation regulator DGCA has issued new COVID-19 norms for airports and flights, making masks mandatory throughout the journey. Mask removal is permitted only during "exceptional circumstances", while those violating the mask mandate may be treated as "unruly passengers" and deboarded before departure, DGCA said. Violators can even be put on the 'no-fly' list, it added.

45.title: Theatre screen catches fire during 'Vikram' screening in Puducherry
45.article_body: The screen of a theatre screening Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram' caught fire in Puducherry on Tuesday evening. No one was injured in the incident, but the screen was completely gutted in the fire. The audience started to panic and rush out of the hall and the screening was immediately stopped, officials said.

46.title: I knew 'Heropanti 2' will not work: 'Heropanti' writer Sanjeev Dutta
46.article_body: Sanjeev Dutta, the writer of Tiger Shroff-starrer 'Heropanti', said he knew the film's sequel 'Heropanti 2' will not work. "I...worked very hard on the original film," added Sanjeev. Talking about the "choti bacchi ho kya" dialogue from 'Heropanti', Sanjeev stated, "It feels good that...[it's] going viral." He said he didn't like the dialogue "hum tumme itne chhed karenge" from 'Dabangg'.

47.title: Kangana falls for viral spoof video of Qatar Airways CEO, calls him 'idiot of a man'
47.article_body: Kangana Ranaut called Qatar Airways CEO Akbar Al Baker an "idiot of a man" after falling for a spoof video. The clip was made in response to a video by Twitter user 'Vashudev' who appealed to Indians to boycott Qatar Airways following Qatar's condemnation of a BJP spokesperson's statements on Prophet Muhammad. She deleted her Instagram Stories after being trolled.

48.title: Legends never die: Richa on video showing Moosewala checking his village kids' alphabets
48.article_body: A video showing late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala checking his village children's alphabets has gone viral. Reacting to it, actress Richa Chadha tweeted, "Legends never die." She added, "Every image from Mansa this morning is breaking my heart into a million pieces. Unshakable sadness." Notably, 'Antim Ardaas' or the last prayer for the singer was held in his village today.

49.title: Ishan Kishan would be the player to watch out for in SA T20Is: Parthiv Patel
49.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said opener Ishan Kishan would be the player to watch out for in the five-match T20I series against South Africa. "If Ishan performs well for the Indian team at the top of the order, he brings a whole new dimension, he is also a left-handed option. I wish that he plays freely," stated Parthiv.

50.title: Does Kejriwal still think Jain is innocent?: Smriti Irani on ED’s seizure
50.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Wednesday asked Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal that does he still think Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain is "innocent"? Her statement came after the ED said it has found 133 gold coins and ₹2.85 crore in cash during a raid conducted on the premises of Jain and his aide.

51.title: 2 minors taken into custody for stabbing man over a slap in Delhi
51.article_body: Police on Wednesday said two minor boys were taken into custody for allegedly stabbing a 27-year-old man to death in south Delhi's Central Market. The victim, Manish, had slapped one of the two minors over a month ago. The minor, along with two others minor boys, went to the market where Manish worked and stabbed him to take revenge.

52.title: Hundreds of cockroaches released during hearing at US court
52.article_body: A courthouse in US' New York was closed for fumigation on Tuesday after hundreds of cockroaches were released during a hearing, according to court officials. The bug release was being investigated while the courthouse was closed for the rest of the day. The cockroaches were released from plastic containers brought into the courthouse.

53.title: 1 killed, dozen injured as car rams into crowd in Germany
53.article_body: A car drove into a crowd of people in Berlin on Wednesday, killing at least one person and injuring over a dozen people. It's not yet clear if the act was intentional, police said. The incident happened near the scene of a fatal attack in 2016, where an ISIS sympathiser ploughed a truck through a Christmas market, killing 11 people.

54.title: Spread fake news but I can't think of taking son from mom: Mankirt on Moosewala
54.article_body: Singer Mankirt Aulakh took to Instagram to post a video of late singer Sidhu Moosewala's mother and wrote about his alleged involvement in the death of the singer. "People can show me in bad light and media can spread fake news but God knows I can't think of snatching a son from his mother," Aulakh wrote.

55.title: What if I write similar things about your family: Arjun on sisters facing trolls
55.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said that while he's "thick-skinned" and able to defend himself against trolls, he feels bad when his family members are attacked online because of him. He added that their behaviour "shows their upbringing". He further said what if he went to the building of these faceless trolls and wrote something derogatory about the women in their families?

56.title: 107 students, teachers get stuck after following online map in Austria; airlifted
56.article_body: As many as 99 students and eight teachers from Germany had to be airlifted from a ridge after they got stuck in the Austrian Alps. The group followed directions using an online map which led them to an unmarked and difficult trail. They had undertaken the journey after one of the teachers found a "classic evening walk" on the internet.

57.title: What's Dostarlimab, used in 'historic' cancer trial where all 12 patients were cured?
57.article_body: All 12 rectal cancer patients of a historic drug trial in the US were cured after they completed a six-month treatment with Dostarlimab. The experimental drug includes laboratory-made molecules called monoclonal antibodies which act as substitute antibodies in human bodies. It was approved for medical use in the US and EU in 2021. The patients took it every three weeks.

58.title: Looked at President’s Gold Medal with expression like 'That's it?': Haasan
58.article_body: Talking about winning the President's Gold Medal for his 1960 film 'Kalathur Kannamma', Kamal Haasan said, "If you see the picture, I am looking at the award with an expression like, 'Bas? Itna hi hai? (What? That's it?)'." "I thought...that I would [receive] a big present...like a mechanical gun," added Haasan. Haasan won the award at the age of 6.

59.title: Feel very happy: Nitin Gadkari as NHAI sets Guinness World Record
59.article_body: As the NHAI set a Guinness World Record by constructing a 75 km road in 105 hours and 33 minutes, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said it’s a proud moment for the entire nation. "Feel very happy to congratulate our exceptional team (at) NHAI," Gadkari added. The road was constructed in single lane on NH-53 section between Amravati and Akola .

60.title: S'pore's Web3 DAO Samudai raises $2.5 mn, Coinbase invests too
60.article_body: Singapore-based DAO platform for building and managing communities in the Web3, Samudai, has closed a pre-Seed financing round of $2.5 million. Investors like FTX Ventures, Sino Global Capital, Coinbase Ventures, Former Coinbase CTO Balaji Srinivasan and Polygon Founder Sandeep Nailwal participated in the round. Samudai was founded by Kushagra Agarwal and Navin.

61.title: 3 offer minor drug-laced drink, gang-rape her in bus in Bihar
61.article_body: A minor girl was allegedly gang-raped inside a bus by three persons in Bihar's West Champaran district on Wednesday, police said. The girl, in her statement to the police, alleged that the driver and his accomplice had offered her a cold drink, which contained a pill. She fell unconscious after consuming the drink and the accused raped her, police said.

62.title: KK was supposed to be having dinner with my family: Vardhan Puri
62.article_body: Actor Vardhan Puri, who is the grandson of late actor Amrish Puri, revealed late singer KK was to have dinner with his family. "KK was supposed to be having dinner with our family in the third week of June because my father...is...a big admirer of his work," he stated. "KK...said...he'd come home to meet dad...have dinner with us," he added.

63.title: 3 killed, 1 injured in lightning incidents in Gujarat
63.article_body: At least three people were killed and one was injured in lightning strike incidents in Gujarat's Patan and Surendranagar districts, police said. One of the deceased, a 35-year-old woman, was working on a field in Patan's Roda village and was struck by lightning amid light rainfall. Another deceased was a 25-year-old tribal man from Nani Kathechi village in Surendranagar.

64.title: Not for 1st time: Kerala Minister on gold smuggling claims against CM
64.article_body: Kerala Tourism Minister PA Mohammed Riyas on Wednesday said it wasn't the first time that Swapna Suresh, an accused in the Kerala gold smuggling case, had made allegations against CM Pinarayi Vijayan. "The CM and party Secretary have reacted to this. Our stand is also the same," said Riyas, who is also the son-in-law of the Chief Minister.

65.title: Andhra Pradesh to provide tractors at subsidised rates to farmers
65.article_body: YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led Andhra Pradesh government has decided to provide tractors at subsidised rates to farmers at custom hiring centres across the state. He launched the scheme called 'YSR Yantra Seva' at Chuttugunta village in Guntur where he flagged off 3,800 tractors. Reddy also transferred ₹175 crore into the accounts of 5,260 farmers through direct benefit transfer.

66.title: Ex-Afghan minister returns to Kabul after Taliban's invitation
66.article_body: A former Afghan minister, who fled Afghanistan last year after the Taliban seized power in the country, returned to Kabul on Wednesday following security assurances from the group, officials said. Ghulam Farooq Wardak, who served in the cabinets of former Presidents Hamid Karzai and Ashraf Ghani, reportedly returned from Turkey. "Most authorities are thinking about returning," Wardak said.

67.title: Coin museum inaugurated in Hyd to celebrate Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav
67.article_body: A coin exhibition, showcasing the history of coin-making and collection at the Saifabad Mint in Hyderabad, was inaugurated on Tuesday as part of the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations. It will display 120 years of coinage history and will be open to the public from June 8 till June 13, 2022, from 10 am to 5 pm.

68.title: 'Antim Ardas' for Moosewala held in Mansa, fans gather to pay tributes
68.article_body: The ‘Antim Ardas’ and ‘Bhog’ ceremonies for late singer Sidhu Moosewala were held by his family members at Baahrali Anaj Mandi in Moosa village of Punjab’s Mansa district on Wednesday. A large number of fans assembled to pay their tributes. Moosewala's parents addressed the gathering. He was shot dead in Mansa on May 29.

69.title: Girls dreaming of playing cricket will dream of doing what Mithali did: Bhogle
69.article_body: Reacting to India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj's retirement from all forms of international cricket, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "You have been a jewel in the crown of Indian cricket." "When another little girl like you once were dreams of playing cricket, she will dream of doing what you did," added Bhogle in his tweet. Mithali scored 10,868 international runs.

70.title: To represent India for 23 years is just amazing: Laxman on Mithali's retirement
70.article_body: Reacting to India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj announcing her retirement, ex-India cricketer VVS Laxman tweeted, "To play for India is a dream a very few fulfill, and to be able to represent the nation for 23 years is just amazing." He added, "You have been a pillar to Women's Cricket...and have shaped the lives of many young girls."

71.title: Please tell me about it too: Sonakshi on wedding rumours with Zaheer Iqbal
71.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha took to Instagram to react to her wedding rumours with actor Zaheer Iqbal. Sharing a video, Sonakshi wrote in the subtitles, "Me to the media: Kyu haath dho kar meri shaadi karwana chahte ho?!?" She captioned the video, "If you've already fixed my mehendi, proposal, roka and sangeet, then please tell me about it too."

72.title: 3 'dangerous' men escape from US jail after cutting holes in ceiling
72.article_body: Three 'armed and dangerous' inmates are on the run after escaping from a prison in US' Missouri by cutting holes in the plaster ceiling of their cells and crawling to a maintenance door that led outside. The men escaped on Friday. Two of the men were in jail on drug and weapons charges, while the third was jailed for theft.

73.title: Weddings banned after 10 pm in Pak, 5-day work week adopted amid electricity crisis
73.article_body: Pakistan government has announced a ban on wedding ceremonies in Islamabad after 10 pm to conserve electricity as the country is going through a power crisis. The country has also reduced its official work week to five days from six in a bid to reduce energy and fuel consumption. "We are facing a severe crisis," Information Minister Marriyum Aurangzeb said.

74.title: Ex-Tesla worker given 2 weeks to accept $15 mn payout over racism
74.article_body: A former elevator operator at Tesla has been given two weeks by a US judge to decide whether to accept $15 million in damages over racial abuse at the firm. A jury had awarded him $6.9 million of compensatory damages and $130 million of punitive damages last October. Judge William Orrick reduced both later saying the jury award was excessive.

75.title: Plant a sapling in my son’s memory: Moosewala's mother at prayer meeting
75.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala's mother Charan Kaur urged his fans to plant a sapling in her son's memory in an emotional appeal to the people who gathered in Punjab's Mansa district for the Antim Ardaas or the prayer meeting on Wednesday. "This will be a real tribute to my son," she said. Moosewala was shot dead on May 29.

76.title: Mithali had been in form longer than some of her teammates had been alive: Jaffer
76.article_body: After Mithali Raj announced her retirement from all forms of international cricket, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Towards the end of her career, Mithali had been in form longer than some of her teammates had been alive." He added, "That's how long she served Indian cricket. Congratulations and thank you @M_Raj03...Good luck for your second innings."

77.title: Took 10 yrs to turn dream into reality: Ayan Mukerji on 'Brahmastra'
77.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, speaking about his upcoming film 'Brahmastra', has said, "'Brahmastra' began in 2011 itself and since then it took me 10 years for us to convert the dream into reality." He added, "The film's inspiration is from our mythology but it is based on today's world." The film features Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

78.title: Her heart is more beautiful than face: Twinkle on mother Dimple's b'day
78.article_body: Twinkle Khanna wished her mother and veteran actress Dimple Kapadia on her 65th birthday. Sharing an old picture with her mother on Instagram, Twinkle wrote, "The birthday girl's heart is even more beautiful than her face. Happy Birthday, Mom!" Twinkle's younger sister Rinke Khanna can also be seen in the picture. Dimple made her Bollywood debut in 1973 with 'Bobby'.

79.title: RBI raises inflation projection for FY23 from 5.7% to 6.7%
79.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Russia-Ukraine war "has led to globalisation of inflation" and announced RBI's decision to raise FY23 inflation projection from 5.7% to 6.7%. "Inflationary pressures have become broad-based and remain largely driven by adverse supply shocks," Das said. RBI's Monetary Policy Committee said inflation is likely to remain above 6% in FY23's first three quarters.

80.title: Centre releases ₹126.7 crore to states for modernisation of police
80.article_body: Centre released ₹126.7 crore to various states for the modernisation of police forces, construction of fortified police stations and other projects. Union Home Ministry disbursed ₹22.59 crore to Chhattisgarh, ₹14.76 crore to Odisha and ₹2.63 crore to Jharkhand under the Security Related Expenditure scheme. A total of ₹7.5 crore was disbursed to Maharashtra under Special Central Assistance scheme.

81.title: I kept in touch with him: Warner on Finch's form in IPL 2022
81.article_body: Australia opener David Warner has revealed he was in touch with his opening partner Aaron Finch during the IPL 2022 and had conversations regarding his technique. "I just said to him not to walk out into the ball," stated Warner. Referring to Finch's unbeaten 61-run innings against Sri Lanka, Warner said, "He's at his best when he's nice and still."

82.title: Telangana BJP MLA booked for hurting religious sentiments
82.article_body: Telangana BJP MLA Raja Singh has been booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments of a community. He allegedly made derogatory remarks against Ajmer Sharif Dargah. The complainant, a resident of Hyderabad, said that a video of Singh making an offensive statement was viral on social media. The police said the authenticity of the video is yet to be confirmed.

83.title: BJP MLA denies revealing identity of Hyderabad gang-rape victim
83.article_body: BJP MLA Raghunandan Rao, who has been booked for revealing the identity of the 17-year-old gang-rape victim in Jubilee Hills, has denied releasing her videos and photos. "These are only rumours as I haven't done anything like this," he said. Rao added, "I don't have any connection with the AIMIM, but Congress and TRS have," he said.

84.title: PMC to pay ₹35 lakh for land to create alternate airport route
84.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will pay a deposit of ₹35 lakh for 2,350 square metres of defence land to create an alternate road to reach the airport from Viman Nagar. "The new alternate route...will be more beneficial for...flyers...coming out from the new terminal building," said Santosh Dhoke, Pune Airport Director. The construction of the alternate route is partially complete.

85.title: 2 women & a man attack, injure traffic police personnel after being stopped in Delhi
85.article_body: A Delhi Traffic Police personnel was injured on being assaulted by a man and two women who were reportedly stopped for triple-riding on a motorcycle on the wrong side of the road. The video shows the personnel being dragged by his collar. As per police, he sustained head injuries. One of the women alleged misconduct by the personnel.

86.title: Have 'solid evidence' against accused in Hyd gang-rape case: Police
86.article_body: The Hyderabad Police investigating the gang-rape of a 17-year-old girl in Jubilee Hills said it has "solid evidence" against the accused. Police have put together the sequence of events after watching CCTV footage for over 12 hours, said Police Commissioner CV Anand. "A few loose ends remain but otherwise we have solid evidence against the accused," he said.

87.title: Starc cuts index finger on shoe spike while bowling, ruled out of 2nd SL T20I
87.article_body: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc has reportedly been ruled out of the second T20I against Sri Lanka due to a finger injury. Starc had slit the index finger of his bowling hand on his shoe spike during the first over of the first T20I. He completed his overs despite the injury, recording figures of 3/26 as Australia won by 10 wickets.

88.title: Central Bank Digital Currency will be introduced this fiscal: RBI
88.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar on Wednesday said the Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC), also known as digital rupee, will be introduced in fiscal year 2022-23. Process of introduction of CBDC will be gradual to avoid any impact on the financial and banking system, Sankar added. Introduction of CBDC was announced in Union Budget 2022.

89.title: NCPCR summons Alappuzha SP over child raising hate slogans at PFI rally
89.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has summoned Alappuzha SP over a minor child who was allegedly seen raising provocative slogans at a Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Kerala. The NCPCR has also sought detailed action taken report from the police by June 14. The commission had earlier sought registration of FIR against those responsible.

90.title: Raj Cong MLA accuses BJP, Subhash Chandra of horse-trading; seeks FIR
90.article_body: Rajasthan Congress MLA Mahendra Choudhary sought an FIR against BJP leaders, including state BJP president Satish Poonia, and independent candidate Subhash Chandra for alleged horse-trading attempts ahead of Rajya Sabha polls. BJP and Chandra are trying to win by misusing central agencies like ED, Choudhary alleged. This comes after Chandra claimed that eight MLAs will cross vote in his favour.

91.title: India could be $20 trillion economy by 2040, says Chief Economic Advisor
91.article_body: If the dollar GDP doubles every seven years, India will be at $20 trillion GDP by 2040 with per capita income close to $15,000, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran said. "India is forecasted by IMF to cross $5 trillion by 2026-27," he stated. "Indian economy is...[in] much better place than many others in the world to face...challenges," Nageswaran added.

92.title: Julia Garner offered role of Madonna in singer's biopic: Report
92.article_body: Actress Julia Garner has been offered the role of Madonna in the singer's upcoming biopic, a report by Variety stated.  The report added Garner's team is expected to accept the offer for the role. "The focus of this film will always be music. Music has kept me going and art has kept me alive," Madonna stated while announcing her film.

93.title: Felt really nice meeting such a legend: Umran on his 1st training session
93.article_body: Recalling his first day of India's training session where he met head coach Rahul Dravid, pacer Umran Malik said, "I felt really nice meeting such a legend. He told me to keep continuing what I'm doing." He added, "I was really excited for the first day...Was positive that I would bowl well in the nets...Everyone here [is] like a brother."

94.title: Decayed human head found in Delhi, police say can't identify or know gender
94.article_body: A decayed human head has been found in Delhi. This comes days after decomposed body parts with missing head and torso were found in the same area. Police said immediately ascertaining the identity and gender of the deceased is not possible. Police added that the head may be of the same person whose body parts were found earlier.

95.title: Ukraine to launch 'Book of Executioners' to record Russian war crimes
95.article_body: Ukraine will launch a "Book of Executioners" next week to record war crimes committed by the Russian forces in the ongoing conflict, said President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "A special publication is to be launched - 'The Book of Executioners' - an information system to collect...data about war criminals, criminals from the Russian army," he said.

96.title: Stone pelting in Jahangirpuri, no casualties reported; 3-5 vehicles damaged
96.article_body: Stone pelting took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri after two groups allegedly got into a fight on Tuesday night. Reports said that no casualties were reported but three to five vehicles were damaged. Police said that there is no communal angle to the fight and it happened as a man and his associates pelted stones and were looking for two locals.

97.title: Title of my 525th movie is finalised, it's 'The Signature': Anupam
97.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher, taking to Instagram, revealed that his 525th film's name is 'The Signature'. "The name of my 525th movie is finalised. Slightly modified but mainly based on your suggestions," he added. Recently, Anupam had asked his fans to help decide the title of the film. "Thank you for helping us decide the title of our film," he stated.

98.title: Use of coal in Delhi-NCR banned from January 1, 2023 onwards
98.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) on Wednesday banned the use of coal for all purposes in Delhi-NCR from January 1, 2023 onwards. Use of coal in regions where PNG supply is available will be banned from October 1, 2022, CAQM said. Use of low-sulphur coal in thermal power plants, however, has been kept out of the ban.

99.title: Ex-US teacher pleads guilty to leading all-female ISIS battalion
99.article_body: A former US school teacher has pleaded guilty to organising and leading an all-female military battalion in Syria on behalf of ISIS.  Allison Fluke-Ekren pleaded guilty to one count of providing support to the group and admitted to training over 100 women and girls. She trained women to use AK-47 assault rifles, grenades and suicide belts, US Justice Department said.

100.title: Deepinder Goyal's ESOPs cost Zomato ₹387 cr in second half of FY22
100.article_body: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal's ESOPs cost the company ₹387 crore in the second half of the financial year ending on March 31, regulatory filings showed. Zomato incurred an expense of ₹778 crore in salaries and other benefits like ESOPs. Among the key managerial personnel, CFO Akshant Goyal's salaries and other expenses amounted to ₹50 lakh.

101.title: 11-yr-old girl among 2 dead, 20 injured as tractor-trolley overturns in UP
101.article_body: An 11-year-old girl and a 50-year-old woman were killed after a tractor-trolley overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri district. According to police, the accident occurred on Tuesday night when the driver of the tractor-trolley lost control over the vehicle and it overturned. Twenty others were injured in the accident, out of which 10 were shifted to district hospital, police added.

102.title: Woman allegedly kills husband in Pune, claims he died by suicide
102.article_body: A case has been registered against a woman who allegedly killed her 35-year-old husband and later claimed that he died by suicide at their home in Pune's Tathawade area. The couple allegedly had a fight, following which the woman attacked her husband with a hard object. She later allegedly hanged him to show it as a suicide.

103.title: Gallery collapses during football match in Kerala; many injured
103.article_body: Several people were injured after a portion of a gallery collapsed during a football match between two regional teams in Kerala's Malappuram district on Monday. The victims were taken to the district hospital in the Nilambur town and other private hospitals nearby for treatment. A similar incident of a stadium gallery collapse in Malappuram was reported in March this year.

104.title: RBI raises limit for recurring payment e-mandate to ₹15,000
104.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday raised the limit for e-mandates for recurring payments such as subscriptions, fees and EMIs from ₹5,000 to ₹15,000. RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, while announcing the decision, said, "This will further leverage the benefits available under the framework and augment customer convenience." RBI also raised the repo rate by 50 basis points on Wednesday.

105.title: Political agenda: Kerala CM on involvement in gold smuggling claim
105.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan denied the allegation of his involvement in the Kerala gold smuggling case, saying it’s a part of the political agenda. His statement came after prime accused in the case, Swapna Suresh, claimed CM, his wife and his daughter were involved in the scam. "There is not even an iota of facts in this allegation," Vijayan added.

106.title: Mithali Raj retires from all forms of international cricket after 23-year-long career
106.article_body: India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj announced her retirement from all forms of international cricket after a career spanning nearly 23 years. "It was an honour to have led the team for so many years...It definitely shaped me as a person," the 39-year-old wrote on social media. Mithali played 12 Tests, 232 ODIs and 89 T20Is, scoring 10,868 international runs.

107.title: If it's high-scoring game, then you want players to maintain strike rate: Dravid
107.article_body: During the virtual press conference ahead of the five-match T20I series against South Africa, Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said he expects players to maintain a strike rate in high-scoring matches in the series. "If the wicket is more challenging, then they have to respond to that as well," he added. The first T20I will be played on Thursday.

108.title: Saw many bad days at KKR, started doubting myself: Kuldeep Yadav
108.article_body: Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav said he had "many" bad days while representing his former IPL franchise KKR, adding that he started doubting himself after not getting chances. "You start thinking, 'What do I have to do? How will I get an opportunity? How will I perform?'" added Kuldeep. Kuldeep picked 21 wickets in IPL 2022 for DC.

109.title: Clear bus lanes of illegally parked private vehicles: Delhi minister
109.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot has directed officials to clear bus lanes of illegally parked private vehicles to ensure seamless traffic movement, as per an official statement. Delhi government on April 1 had started an intensive enforcement drive for buses and goods carriage vehicles. As of June 6, around 28,000 challans have been issued under the drive.

110.title: What will happen to parents who've lost their young son: Mika on Moosewala
110.article_body: Singer Mika, while talking about the death of singer Sidhu Moosewala, said that if the late singer's fans are shocked and if Mika himself is sad, what will happen to the parents who have lost their young son. "Whatever happened is wrong. It should not have happened," he said, adding that everyone should be together in such time.

111.title: Consider Marathi as optional language for UP students: Maha BJP leader to CM Yogi
111.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Kripashankar Singh requested UP CM Yogi Adityanath to consider Marathi as an optional language for the students of Secondary and Higher Secondary in UP. In a letter to UP CM, Singh wrote, "That may help students in getting better jobs in Maharashtra." "A big chunk of students…get migrated to Maharashtra for getting appropriate jobs," he added.

112.title: Democratic system will collapse in absence of police reforms: Ex-IPS officer
112.article_body: The Democratic system will collapse if police reforms are not carried out and the force continues to work under colonial model, said former Indian Police Service (IPS) officer Prakash Singh. "If you want good detection of crime...good law and order, then there is no escaping from having police reforms," said Singh, who has served as UP and Assam police chief.

113.title: All of Bengal's top 9 batters score 50+ in same first-class innings, create world record
113.article_body: All of Bengal's top nine batters scored 50-plus runs in the first innings against Jharkhand in Ranji Trophy quarter-final. This is the first time in first-class cricket history that nine players have gone past the 50-run mark in the same innings. Sudip Kumar Gharami top-scored for Bengal with 186(380) as they declared their innings on 773/7.

114.title: BJP releases candidate list for MLC polls in 3 states, KP Maurya fielded in UP
114.article_body: BJP has released a list of 16 candidates for the upcoming Legislative Council elections in three states - Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra and Bihar. UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya, who lost the Assembly election from Sirathu seat, has been named in the list with eight other candidates for UP. Five candidates have been named for Maharashtra and two for Bihar.

115.title: Kejriwal mastermind of corruption: Manoj Tiwari on ED’s raid against Jain
115.article_body: After the ED found ₹2.85 crore in cash and 133 gold coins on raiding Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain and his aide's premises, BJP leader Manoj Tiwari said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is the "mastermind" of this corruption. "The way Arvind Kejriwal is defending Satyendar Jain, I believe that Kejriwal is the mastermind of this corruption," Tiwari added.

116.title: Fire breaks out at restaurant in Pune's Aundh, no casualties reported
116.article_body: A fire broke out at a restaurant located on the eighth floor of a building in the Aundh suburb of Pune on Wednesday, fire brigade officials said. The fire was reported at 5.45 am in the dining area of Sky Garage restaurant, which also houses a bar. The fire has been doused and no casualties have been reported so far.

117.title: Amber Heard responds after Johnny Depp's 'moving forward' post for his supporters
117.article_body: Amber Heard has responded after Johnny Depp's "moving forward" post on social media platforms. "As Johnny Depp says he's 'moving forward', women's rights are moving backward. The verdict's message to victims of domestic violence is...be afraid to stand up and speak out," a representative for Heard said. Depp had posted a video thanking his supporters.

118.title: Director Todd Phillips confirms sequel to 'Joker' on Instagram
118.article_body: Director Todd Phillips has confirmed a sequel to his 2019 film 'Joker'. Taking to Instagram, Todd shared the cover of the script of the sequel with the title "Joker: Folie a Deux". As per the Instagram post, the script is written by Todd and Scott Silver. Joaquin Phoenix played the lead in the 2019 film.

119.title: Congratulations for historic accomplishment: PM Modi on Avani's world record
119.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated shooter Avani Lekhara for securing the gold medal with a world record score of 250.6 in women's 10m Air Rifle Standing SH1 at the Chateauroux Para Shooting World Cup. "Congratulations Avani for this historic accomplishment. May you keep scaling newer heights of success and inspiring others," PM Modi tweeted.

120.title: Game changer: Paytm CEO on RBI move to allow linking credit cards to UPI
120.article_body: Reacting to RBI's announcement that credit cards will be allowed to be linked with UPI, Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma tweeted, "This is a game changer move by RBI." He added, "Also the beginning of MDR/ Interchange of card networks starting to apply on mobile payments." Notably, linking of credit cards with UPI will begin with RuPay cards.

121.title: Norway says it donated 22 howitzers to Ukraine amid war
121.article_body: The Norwegian government on Wednesday said that it has donated as many as 22 self-propelled howitzers to Ukraine, which is at war with Russia. It said it also donated spare parts, ammunition and other gear. "The Norwegian government has waited to publicly announce the donation for security reasons. Future donations may not be announced or commented upon," it said.

122.title: Umran might play a few games but who cares about bilateral matches: Manjrekar
122.article_body: Sharing his opinion on India's upcoming five-match T20I series against South Africa, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "[Umran Malik] might play a couple of matches but bilateral matches who cares, it is about the big marquee event, the ICC events." "That's where they (selectors) will be wondering if it is...too early to rush him into that kind of a stage," added Manjrekar.

123.title: Was p*****g myself laughing between takes: Zendaya on 'No Way Home'
123.article_body: Actress Zendaya, while having a conversation with Andrew Garfield in an interview, talked about her experience of shooting 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' with Andrew, Tobey Maguire and Tom Holland. "I was p*****g myself laughing...You guys had me dying, like crying laughing in between takes all the time," she added. The duo recalled an "inside joke" about Tobey over his forearms.

124.title: BJP carrying out 'cultural atrocity' via textbook revision: Shivakumar
124.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Tuesday accused the state government of carrying out 'cultural atrocity' through its textbook revision decision. "The BJP government has resorted to the cultural atrocity by twisting many great ideas, including Kuvempu in the children's revised textbook," Shivakumar alleged. He further stated that Congress will protest against the issue on June 9.

125.title: 7 samples matched with family members' DNA in Mundka fire tragedy
125.article_body: After submitting reports to the Delhi Police, the forensic teams matched seven samples with the DNA of the family members of the missing persons in Delhi's Mundka fire tragedy. Twenty seven bodies of victims have been preserved at the Sanjay Gandhi Hospital. Blood samples of their family members were earlier sent for DNA profiling and matching.

126.title: Filled with passion, love & sincerity: Vijay Deverakonda on 'Major'
126.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Vijay Deverakonda praised Adivi Sesh's film 'Major'. "A film filled with passion, love and sincerity...Definitely watch this one to know about our hero," Vijay tweeted. "Congratulations to the entire team! And my warmest respect and love to the parents of Major Sandeep [Unnikrishnan]," he added. The film also featured Saiee Manjrekar and Sobhita Dhulipala.

127.title: Shooter Avani Lekhara wins gold with world record in Para World Cup
127.article_body: Tokyo Paralympics gold medallist Avani Lekhara won gold at the Para Shooting World Cup with a world record score of 250.6 in women’s 10m Air Rifle Standing SH1 in Chateauroux, France on Tuesday. The 20-year-old shooter broke her own world record of 249.6 to secure her a spot at the 2024 Paris Paralympics.

128.title: Accused used govt vehicle in Hyd's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case: Police
128.article_body: The accused in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case used a government vehicle to commit crime, Hyderabad City Commissioner of Police CV Anand said. "The vehicle was allotted to one of the accused's father, who is a government employee. Two vehicles were used...and were driven by minors," he added. A 17-year-old girl was gang-raped in Jubilee Hills area on May 28.

129.title: Credit cards can now be linked to UPI, starting with RuPay: RBI
129.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday announced that credit cards will now be allowed to be linked with the UPI accounts. The implementation will begin with the indigenous RuPay credit cards, followed by other card networks such as Visa and Mastercard. Until now, customers could only link their debit cards to UPI.

130.title: Kamal Haasan gifts Lexus car to 'Vikram' director, Apache bikes to 13 assistant directors
130.article_body: Following the success of 'Vikram', actor Kamal Haasan gifted a Lexus car to the film's director Lokesh Kanagaraj. He also gifted Apache RTR 160 bikes to 13 assistant directors who worked on the film. The film has crossed ₹200-crore earnings worldwide in the first five days of its release. 'Vikram' is Kamal Haasan's third film to cross ₹100-crore earnings worldwide.

131.title: World Bank approves $1.49 billion in further aid to Ukraine
131.article_body: The World Bank's executive board has approved an additional fund of $1.49 billion for Ukraine amid its ongoing war with Russia. With this, the total monetary assistance it pledged to aid Ukraine crossed to over $4 billion. The latest funding was backed by countries including Britain, the Netherlands, Lithuania, Latvia and Italy.

132.title: Russia losing 300 soldiers a day: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
132.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claimed that over 31,000 Russian soldiers have lost their lives in Ukraine since the invasion began. "Since February 24, Russia has been paying almost 300 lives a day for a completely pointless war," Zelenskyy said. "And still the day will come when the number of losses, even for Russia, will exceed the permissible limit," he added.

133.title: He's Hercules, even surprises his own team: Aus Open director on Nadal
133.article_body: Australian Open director Craig Tiley said Rafael Nadal is "Hercules", adding that he even surprises his own team. "[His team is] just as surprised as the rest of us are because never did Rafa himself think that [he will win the French Open]," stated Tiley. "To...win it as convincingly as he did in the [final] is honestly remarkable," said Tiley.

134.title: Suspected cattle carcasses found in Noida dump yard; police begin probe
134.article_body: Police have launched an investigation after suspected cattle carcasses were found in a dump yard in Noida. A passerby informed the police about the carcasses at around 12:30 am on Tuesday, police said, adding that it might have been thrown on Monday night. "Four police teams have been formed to investigate...case," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Central Noida) Harish Chander.

135.title: Rahul Tripathi was the best no. 3 batter of IPL 2022: Sehwag
135.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has praised SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, terming him the "best number three batter" of IPL 2022. "If you look at all teams, if there's one player who attained most success at number three, it's Rahul Tripathi...he contributed a lot to SRH winning five matches in a row," stated Sehwag. Tripathi scored 413 runs in IPL 2022.

136.title: 17 people killed, 50 injured as train derails in Iran
136.article_body: At least 17 people have been killed and 50 others have been injured after a train derailed in Iran on Wednesday, state TV reported. Of those wounded, over 12 have sustained severe injuries, officials said. The passenger train derailed on the Tabas-Yazd line in eastern Iran. According to reports, the accident took place after the train collided with an excavator.

137.title: Problematic in hierarchal organisations: Cong leader on CDS selection pool widening
137.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari said widening the pool for selection of CDS is not necessarily a bad idea but in "strictly regimented" and "hierarchal organisations" it may be problematic to put a retired officer over serving chiefs. The Centre issued three separate notifications amending the rules of the Army, Navy and Air Force for the appointment of the next CDS.

138.title: Cancer vanishes in all 12 patients for the '1st time in history' during drug trial in US
138.article_body: Cancer vanished in all 12 patients who participated in a drug trial in US, with a doctor saying, "I believe this is the first time this has happened in history of cancer." The rectal cancer patients were given dostarlimab every three weeks for six months. Results of the trial have been published in The New England Journal of Medicine.

139.title: He fired 17 or 19 shots: Spurs' Emerson on being robbed at gunpoint
139.article_body: Sharing his experience of being robbed at gunpoint, Tottenham Hotspur defender Emerson Royal said, "When I give him what he wants...he unlocks his gun to shoot me...He starts shooting everywhere and doesn't hit anyone." "He fired 17 or 19 shots," added Emerson. "I understood that it was a moment that could cost me my life," stated Emerson.

140.title: Muslims need to give up 'kafir', 'ummah' & 'jihad': RSS leader
140.article_body: Muslims need to give up three concepts - 'kafir' (non-believer), 'ummah' (a supra-national community tied by religion) and 'jihad' (struggle, sometimes used for 'holy war'), said RSS leader Ram Madhav. He added that once Indian Muslims "accept" that their roots predate Islamic invasions, Hindus will stop talking about the "destruction that happened hundreds of years ago".

141.title: Launching Moto g82 5G's revolutionary Billion Colour Display: Motorola
141.article_body: Motorola India announced that it has disrupted the sub-20K smartphone market by launching Moto g82 5G with 10-bit billion colour display, starting at ₹19,999*. The phone's pOLED display supports 120Hz refresh rate for the most fluid experience, the brand stated. Moto g82 5G will go on sale on Flipkart, Reliance Digital and leading retail stores starting 14th June 2022.

142.title: I think Root is going to get very close to Sachin's Test tally: Watson
142.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said England's Joe Root is going to get "very close" to Sachin Tendulkar's record of most runs in Test cricket. "Root has got a lot of great cricket in front of him," he added. Tendulkar ended his career with 15,921 runs in 200 Tests while Root currently has 10,015 runs in 118 Tests.

143.title: Have been working hard on my T20 game: Hazlewood on 4-wicket haul vs SL
143.article_body: Talking about his four-wicket haul against Sri Lanka in their first T20I, Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood said he has been focusing on the shortest format of the game. "The wicket was slow...the new ball flew off the bat a little bit, and we dragged [the length back]," he added. Australia won the match by 10 wickets.

144.title: Coach asked me to sleep with him, said I should behave like his wife: Indian woman cyclist
144.article_body: A top Indian woman cyclist, in her complaint to Sports Authority of India, said the national team's chief coach RK Sharma allegedly forced her into his room in Slovenia and asked her to sleep with him. "He made comments like...I should behave like his wife as he's extremely fond of me and wants me to be his wife," she added.

145.title: 16-yr-old UP boy shoots mother dead for stopping him from playing PUBG
145.article_body: A 16-year-old boy allegedly shot his mother dead after she debarred him from playing PUBG in UP's Lucknow, police said. "A preliminary probe revealed he was addicted to the game...mother used to stop him from playing...he committed the (crime) with his father's pistol," police added. The boy tried to mislead the police by "narrating a fake story about some electrician".

146.title: Such rhetoric will tarnish country’s image: Cong's Adhir on Prophet remarks
146.article_body: Following former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury said if such "rhetoric" is allowed in India, it will only "tarnish" the country's image. "Strict action should be taken against those responsible for tarnishing the country’s image. Do not try to save them by making excuses," he added.

147.title: Car hits bull on Eastern Peripheral Expressway near Greater Noida, 2 injured
147.article_body: Two men were injured after their car hit a bull on the Eastern Peripheral Expressway near Greater Noida on Monday evening. "The black bull was not visible in...dark and the car crashed into it as the animal was standing in the middle of the expressway," a police officer said. The car was badly damaged in the accident, he added.

148.title: Indian cycling team called back from Slovenia after cyclist accuses coach of misbehaviour
148.article_body: The Sports Authority of India (SAI) has called the entire Indian contingent back to India from Slovenia after a female cyclist accused chief coach RK Sharma of "inappropriate behaviour". The Indian endurance contingent, comprising five male and one female cyclists, was scheduled to return on June 14. An inquiry committee has been formed to look into the matter.

149.title: Better.com CEO who fired 900 on Zoom call sued for 'misleading investors'
149.article_body: A former Better.com executive has sued the company and CEO Vishal Garg, alleging they provided misleading statements to ensure investors go through with a SPAC merger instead of withdrawing due to its financial condition. Last year, Garg had to apologise for his manner of handling layoffs after a video of him firing 900 employees over a Zoom call went viral.

150.title: Don't let them dull your shine: Malaika on Arjun's reply to a troll
150.article_body: Malaika Arora, taking to Instagram Stories, reacted to her boyfriend Arjun Kapoor's reply to an Instagram user who said Arjun can "never get in shape". Arjun took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "Fitness isn't about a six-pack, fitness is about mental, emotional...physical well being." Reacting to it, Malaika wrote, "Don't ever let these trolls and criticism dull your shine."

151.title: 70 yrs after extinction in India, 1st Cheetah batch to arrive from Africa
151.article_body: After 70 years of their extinction in India, first batch of cheetahs is all set to arrive from South Africa in August. The batch of five-six cheetahs will be translocated to Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh. "All the modalities for bringing cheetahs have been completed and the agreement with South Africa is in place," an official said.

152.title: Fire breaks out at electric motor parking in Delhi, over 90 vehicles gutted
152.article_body: A fire broke out at the electric motor parking in Delhi's Jamia Nagar, Delhi Fire Service officials said. A total of 10 cars, one motorcycle, two scooty, 30 new e-rickshaws and 50 old e-rickshaws caught fire, they added. As many as seven fire tenders were rushed to the spot and the fire was brought under control, the officials stated.

153.title: Which are the top 10 most expensive locations for overseas workers?
153.article_body: Hong Kong is the most expensive location for overseas workers, followed by New York, Geneva, London and Tokyo, according to ECA International. Tel Aviv has been ranked sixth followed by Zurich, Shanghai, Guangzhou and Seoul. ECA International has been conducting research into cost of living for 50 years.

154.title: Lalu Yadav fined ₹6,000 in 13-yr-old poll code violation case
154.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav was fined ₹6,000 in a 13-year-old case related to model code violation by a court in Jharkhand's Palamu. During the 2009 Assembly elections campaign, Yadav's helicopter landed on a paddy field instead of the designated spot in Garhwa town where he was to address a rally. This was found in violation of the poll code.

155.title: Nupur Sharma entitled to her opinions, Hindu Gods insulted every day: Kangana
155.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, while talking about BJP leader Nupur Sharma's suspension over her remarks about the Prophet, said that Sharma is entitled to her opinions. "When Hindu Gods are insulted, which they are almost every day, we go to court, please do that. No need to play dons yourself, this is not Afghanistan," she wrote on Instagram.

156.title: I was 18 when I converted to Islam, being a Muslim is not easy: Pogba
156.article_body: Ex-Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba said late boxing legend Muhammad Ali is his inspiration, adding that he converted to Islam just like Ali converted to Islam. "I was 18 and sometimes...[being] a Muslim is not easy," stated Pogba. "He saved a lot of people...just by giving a good message...saying the truth when it was difficult to say," said Pogba.

157.title: Passengers can now carry foldable bicycles in Bengaluru Metro
157.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has announced that commuters can carry foldable bicycles in the last coach of metro trains during their travel without any luggage charge. The size of the foldable bicycles shouldn't exceed 60 cm x 45 cm x 25 cm in dimension and not exceed 15 kg in weight, BMRCL Managing Director Anjum Parwez said.

158.title: BJP youth wing functionary arrested over tweet on Prophet Muhammad
158.article_body: A BJP youth wing functionary, Harshit Srivastav, who was the former Kanpur Nagar's Yuva Morcha district secretary, was arrested for his alleged inflammatory tweet against Prophet Muhammad. This comes days after clashes erupted in Kanpur over objectionable remarks made by Nupur Sharma, who was suspended from BJP. A total of 50 persons have been arrested in connection with Kanpur violence.

159.title: Judge who ordered video survey of Gyanvapi mosque gets threat, security increased
159.article_body: Civil Judge Ravi Diwakar, who passed orders for the video survey of Gyanvapi mosque, has received a threat letter from the Islamic Agaz Movement. According to the police, a total of nine police personnel have been deployed for his security. Moreover, officials said that the security of the civil judge in Varanasi and his mother in Lucknow is being reviewed.

160.title: Want laws that won't make it easy for bad guys to get guns: McConaughey
160.article_body: While speaking at the White House, Hollywood actor Matthew McConaughey appealed for gun control legislation to be passed in honour of the victims of the Texas school shooting incident. "We want secure and safe schools and we want gun laws that won't make it so easy for the bad guys to get the damn guns," he added.

161.title: Said that because we all are one family: Pakistan's Rizwan on 'Our Virat Kohli' remark
161.article_body: Talking about his 'He's our Virat Kohli' remark, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan said, "If I said 'he's our Virat Kohli', it's because we all are a family." "Other players told me 'Virat is aggressive and all'. But the way he met me before and after the match...it was amazing," Rizwan further said about meeting Kohli during T20 World Cup 2021.

162.title: Nothing found at Satyendar Jain's house, BJP lying: AAP on ED's raid
162.article_body: AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj said that nothing was found at Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain’s house during the raid conducted by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). "They (BJP) are lying…They spread fake rumours that cash and gold coins were recovered," Bharadwaj added. "The seizure memo of the ED raid was given to the wife and daughter of Satyendar Jain," he stated.

163.title: Odisha launches helpline number for protection of abandoned animals
163.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday launched a state helpline number to provide emergency healthcare services to abandoned and stray animals in the state. The toll-free number '1962 or 155333' will be available round the clock and will extend veterinary service through animal ambulance in 11 urban areas. The CM also launched a tele-veterinary service.

164.title: Iran conducts mass execution of 12 Baluch prisoners: Report
164.article_body: Iran carried out a mass execution of 12 prisoners, all belonging to the minority community of Baluch, said Norway-based Iran Human Rights (IHR) on Tuesday. The 12, including one woman, were hanged on Monday after being convicted on drug-related or murder charges. The woman was sentenced to death for the murder of her husband.

165.title: Proud to be part of their conscious inclusiveness: Farhan on Ms Marvel
165.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar penned a note ahead of the release of his show 'Ms Marvel'. "I'm proud to be a part of their conscious inclusiveness," he stated. "The show is...celebration of diversity...it certainly will bring joy and pride of self-identity to millions of...girls and boys of the sub-continent," he added. Farhan praised Iman Vellani, who plays the titular role.

166.title: Challenging with cars passing but got ready in 5 mins: Fatima on sea link shoot
166.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh said that it was challenging to shoot at the Bandra-Worli sea link with passing cars and less time. "And [there were] no vanity vans. But, it was fun shooting on the streets...Fortunately, I didn't have to worry about my makeover as it would take me just five minutes to get ready," she added.

167.title: Depp's lawyer Camille promoted to partner at firm after Amber Heard trial success
167.article_body: Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez has been elevated to partner at the firm she works with following the role she played as a member of actor's legal team during the defamation trial against Amber Heard. "Camille's performance...proved to the world that she was ready to take this next step now. We are incredibly proud of her," the firm said.

168.title: Spoke to Salman, he said 'You've to do it': Saiee Manjrekar on Major
168.article_body: Actress Saiee M Manjrekar said she discussed her role in Adivi Sesh-starrer 'Major' with Salman Khan, adding he said she has to do the role. Talking about Adivi, Saiee stated that everyone says he is mean, with her 'Major' co-star Sobhita Dhulipala jokingly terming him as a "torture star". Saiee made her Bollywood debut in 'Dabangg 3' which starred Salman.

169.title: Ukraine urges Israel to sell its Iron Dome rocket interceptor
169.article_body: Ukraine has urged Israel to sell its Iron Dome rocket interception system to help it fight against Russian forces. At a press conference in Tel Aviv, Ukrainian ambassador to Israel Yevgen Korniychuk also asked the country to provide anti-tank missiles. The envoy accused the Israeli government of staying in its comfort zone even as "Russia slaughters our citizens".

170.title: Action taken after Muslim countries protested: Owaisi on BJP leaders’ suspension
170.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that PM Narendra Modi took action against Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal only after Muslim countries raised their voices. "PM Modi took action after Muslim countries protested," Owaisi added. "We are angry that the PM (Narendra Modi) did not pay heed to the Muslims who are residents of this country," he stated.

171.title: RBI hikes repo rate by 50 bps to 4.90%, 2nd hike in 2 months
171.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the central bank has raised the repo rate by 50 bps to 4.90%. The announcement was made following a three-day meet of the Monetary Policy Committee. The hike comes after the central bank announced a 40 bps increase in repo rate in an off-cycle policy move in May.

172.title: Noida's Supertech twin towers to be demolished on August 21
172.article_body: Noida's Supertech twin towers will be tentatively demolished on August 21, officials said. "The decision has been taken in order to create a buffer period so that the work is completed in any case by August 28," Noida Authority CEO Ritu Maheshwari added. This comes after the Supreme Court in May extended the deadline for demolition to August 28.

173.title: BA.5 variant of COVID-19 found in 31-year-old woman in Pune
173.article_body: A 31-year-old woman from Pune was found positive for BA.5 subvariant of Omicron COVID-19 variant, according to the latest report of whole genomic sequencing from BJ Medical College. The woman was asymptomatic and recovered in home isolation. Maharashtra on May 28 had reported its first cases of BA.4 and BA.5 subvariants of Omicron in at least seven cases in Pune.

174.title: China's BYD to supply batteries to Tesla 'very soon'
174.article_body: China's BYD is preparing to supply Elon Musk-owned Tesla with batteries "very soon", BYD's Executive Vice President Lian Yubo said. "We are now good friends with Elon Musk," Yubo said. China's CATL is currently the sole supplier of LFP batteries to Tesla, while Panasonic and LG Energy Solutions are the main suppliers of nickel-and-cobalt based cells.

175.title: Would tell Karan 'Please don't think, sit down': Farah on 'Rocky...'
175.article_body: Discussing the upcoming Ranveer Singh starrer 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', choreographer Farah Khan said she would ask the film's director Karan Johar to "not think" and just sit down during the film's shooting. "That's how we both are," added Farah. Farah stated there was a "ghost" in her room while shooting in Scotland for 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'.

176.title: 4 held for killing businessman in B'luru, cash & valuables recovered
