176.article_body: Police have arrested a gang of four people in connection with the murder of an elderly businessman in his flat in Bengaluru's Chamarajpet and recovered valuables and cash worth ₹4.93 crore. Earlier, police arrested the prime accused Bijaram, who was employed at Jugraj Jain's shop, from Gujarat. The accused and his four accomplices had allegedly murdered Jain on May 24.

177.title: Main focus will be on domestic cricket and IPL: Wriddhiman on Team India snub
177.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Wriddhiman Saha has said that since he won't be picked in Team India squads, his main focus now will be on domestic cricket and IPL. "No, no, it's difficult to devote time to the family. So, I just want to spend some quality time with them now," he said about the possibility of him playing County cricket.

178.title: Which states have most active COVID-19 cases as India reported 40% jump in daily cases?
178.article_body: India on Wednesday reported over 40% rise in daily COVID-19 cases with 5,233 fresh infections. Kerala has the most active COVID-19 cases in the country at 9,857, followed by Maharashtra with 8,432 active cases and Karnataka with 2,478 active cases. Delhi has 1,534 active COVID-19 cases while Tamil Nadu has 927 active cases.

179.title: Norwegian Princess Märtha Louise gets engaged to self-professed shaman Durek, shares pic
179.article_body: Norway's 50-year-old Princess Märtha Louise got engaged to self-professed American shaman Durek Verrett. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Louise wrote, "I'm so happy to announce...I'm engaged to Shaman Durek, the one who makes my heart skip, the one who sees me and acknowledges me from my highest potential, who makes me laugh and who I can be vulnerable with."

180.title: Sonia Gandhi, suffering from COVID-19, seeks more time from ED
180.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi has sought more time from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to appear for questioning as she has not yet recovered from COVID-19, reported PTI quoting sources. Gandhi had tested positive for the virus last Thursday. She and her son, Rahul Gandhi, have been summoned by the ED in connection with the National Herald case.

181.title: 17-yr-old killed in Delhi over refusal to give ₹10 for cigarette, 4 held
181.article_body: Police arrested four men for allegedly stabbing a 17-year-old boy to death in Delhi's Anand Parbat after he refused to give them ₹10 for a cigarette. After stabbing, they took out his wallet containing ₹150 and fled, leaving him to die, police said. The investigating team questioned locals and scanned footage from CCTVs where victim's body was found, police added.

182.title: Over 40% jump in daily COVID-19 cases in India with 5,233 infections in 24 hours
182.article_body: India has reported 5,233 COVID-19 cases, 3,345 recoveries and 7 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,714 COVID-19 cases and 7 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 28,857, while the death toll reached 5,24,715.

183.title: Was told 'you're in a hurry, this is temporary': Guj woman on marrying self
183.article_body: Kshama Bindu, a 24-year-old digital creator from Gujarat, who will be marrying herself on June 11, said that her friends asked her to "take time". "[They said] I'm in a hurry and I might change my mind and this is a temporary decision...But I told them that I already took two-three months to think about it," Bindu added.

184.title: US family sues Meta over 19-year-old daughter's eating disorder
184.article_body: A US family has sued Meta over their 19-year-old daughter's eating disorder. Lawyers for Alexis Spence claim that her "addictive" use of Instagram caused her to also suffer from self-harm. The lawsuit cites Facebook Papers, a trove of internal company documents that revealed the tech giant knew Instagram was worsening body-image and other mental-health issues among teenage girls in particular.

185.title: Wanted to highlight social taboo entertainingly: Nushrratt on 'Janhit...'
185.article_body: Speaking about playing a condom seller in her upcoming film 'Janhit Mein Jaari', actress Nushrratt Bharuccha said that they aimed to highlight a "serious social taboo" entertainingly. "Whoever has seen the film has told me that it is not preachy since certain things can be only said this way," she stated. The film will release on June 10.

186.title: BMC to start 1,300 new digital classrooms in Mumbai civic schools
186.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation is planning to start 1,300 new digital classrooms from the current education year across civic-run schools in Mumbai. "We've completed the preparations and...installed all the curriculum on electronic devices," said Joint Municipal Commissioner Ajit Kumbhar. In digital classrooms, different subjects are taught on digital boards through audio-visual content.

187.title: Everyone kept asking me 'Yeh kya banaya': Maker Anees on 'Pyaar...'
187.article_body: Talking about his 1998 Ajay Devgn starrer 'Pyaar To Hona Hi Tha', the film's director Anees Bazmee said, "Everyone kept asking me, 'Yeh kya banaya hai? (What have I made)." "The critics did not tell...if it was a good or a bad film, they simply asked me 'Yeh kya banaya hai?' because...Ajay worked only in action films [then]," added Anees.

188.title: BJP will work to end dynastic misrule in Telangana: PM Modi
188.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday met BJP corporators in Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) and other party leaders from Telangana. "We had wide-ranging discussions on how to focus on community service endeavours and help people at the grassroots," he said in a tweet. "BJP will work for good governance and ending dynastic misrule in Telangana," he added.

189.title: Man murders canteen staffer after argument over tea in Mumbai
189.article_body: A canteen staffer of a private company was allegedly murdered by an employee of the same firm over serving 'tasteless tea'. The incident took place on Monday night in Mumbai's Bhayandar (East). The duo had reportedly picked up an argument following which the victim complained to the supervisor. This enraged the accused who later allegedly stabbed victim with a knife.

190.title: Pay attention to line and length but don't reduce pace: Irfan to Umran Malik
190.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said pacer Umran Malik, who has been named in India's squad for South Africa T20Is, needs to pay attention to his line and length but shouldn't reduce his pace. "Simple advice for him, after every match...[think about] what you have done well and where you have to improve...Sachin Tendulkar [followed] this process," added Irfan.

191.title: Who are the most followed people on Instagram?
191.article_body: Virat Kohli on Tuesday reached 200 million followers on Instagram. Kohli is the 14th most followed person on Instagram. Portuguese footballer Cristiano Ronaldo is the most followed person on Instagram, with more than 451 million followers. He is followed by Kylie Jenner (345 million), Lionel Messi (334 million), Selena Gomez (325 million) and Dwayne Johnson (320 million).

192.title: All 6 accused, including AIMIM MLA's minor son, held in Hyd gang-rape case
192.article_body: All six accused, including five juveniles and one major, have been arrested in connection with the case in which a 17-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills on May 28, police said on Tuesday. One of the juvenile accused is an AIMIM MLA's son. "Of the accused, four...produced before Juvenile Home...two will be produced today," police added.

193.title: Al-Qaeda threatens suicide bombings in Delhi, Mumbai, UP, Gujarat over Prophet remarks
193.article_body: The Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) has said it would launch suicide bombings in Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat to "fight for the honour of the Prophet". This comes after ex-BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal made remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Central intelligence agencies are on alert and all the states have been informed about the threat.

194.title: Pune's 10th child-friendly police station set up in Range Hills area
194.article_body: Pune's tenth child-friendly police station has been set up in Range Hills under the Khadki police station. "Children get scared when they come to police station...such an area is created where policemen are also wearing civil clothes to help these juveniles adjust well to the environment...We are trying to get this system in...all of Pune," Deputy Commissioner of Police said.

195.title: 30-yr-old Delhi man attacks woman friend with knife, consumes acid later
195.article_body: A 30-year-old man allegedly stabbed his woman friend with a knife, injuring her thigh, and later consumed acid in Delhi's Ranhola, police said. The accused recently got married to another woman following which the victim started ignoring him which enraged him, police added. After his marriage, the man kept insisting the victim to continue their relationship, police further said.

196.title: Virat Kohli becomes first Indian to reach 200 million followers on Instagram
196.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has become the first Indian to reach 200 million followers on Instagram. Sharing a video having his pictures and clips, Kohli wrote on Instagram, "200 million strong. Thanks for all your support Insta fam." Kohli is the third-most followed sportsperson on the photo and video sharing platform after Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.

197.title: NHAI sets Guinness record by constructing 75km road in 105 hrs 33 mins
197.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has set a Guinness World Record by constructing "75km continuous bituminous concrete road in single lane on NH-53 section between Amravati and Akola in 105 hours and 33 minutes", Minister of Road Transport & Highways Nitin Gadkari tweeted. Gadkari shared pictures of the road and also posted the Guinness certificate.

198.title: discovery+ launches 'My Daughter Joined a Cult'
198.article_body: discovery+ has premiered a new original docu-series titled 'My Daughter Joined a Cult'. Documenting claims made by ex-devotees, the series follows the life of the controversial and self-styled godman, Swami Nithyananda whilst giving a voice to individuals who were at the epicenter of it all, said the brand.

199.title: ED's recovery is proof of Satyendar Jain's honesty: BJP leader
199.article_body: Criticising Aam Aadmi Party and Satyendar Jain after ED raids, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla said the recovery of ₹2.85 crore and 133 gold coins "is proof of Satyendar Jain's honesty". Poonawalla said, "CM Arvind Kejriwal who claims to be the most honest, has not yet been able to take the resignation of his Health-Minister-turned-hawalaat-minister."

200.title: Woman trampled to death by wild elephant in Assam's Nagaon
200.article_body: A woman was trampled to death and another person was critically injured in an attack by a wild elephant at Singimari tea garden area in Assam's Nagaon district, officials said. The woman, Asulata Mallik, was killed in the attack by the wild elephant, while Sapan Mallik was admitted to a local hospital for treatment, officials added.

201.title: Only 2 guards given to Moosewala, while 10 have been given to Lawrence Bishnoi: Richa
201.article_body: Richa Chadha has asked why gangster Lawrence Bishnoi is being given high-level protection while the same was not given to late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. "Only 2 guards were given to Moosewala while 10 have been remanded to Lawrence Bishnoi, in addition to the best and dangerous bulletproof car of Delhi Police," she tweeted. "#JusticeForSidhuMoosewala," wrote Richa.

202.title: I've seen my chachu Inzamam play here: Imam-ul-Haq on playing in Multan
202.article_body: Speaking about playing his first international match in Multan, Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq stated, "I've always seen my chachu (uncle, Inzamam-ul-Haq) play here. So, I'm very excited." He added, "I was born here and even while coming from the bus, I was remembering how things were in my childhood." Pakistan will face West Indies in first ODI in Multan on Wednesday.

203.title: Will ensure justice for Sidhu Moosewala's family: Rahul Gandhi
203.article_body: Criticising AAP government over the law and order situation in Punjab, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said Congress will ensure justice to the family of Sidhu Moosewala. "It is difficult to express the pain experienced by the parents of Congress leader Sidhu Moosewalaji," he tweeted. Rahul Gandhi met the family of the late singer in Punjab's Mansa on Tuesday.

204.title: 15-day-old infant sold for ₹5.50 lakh in MP’s Indore, 6 arrested
204.article_body: Police arrested six persons from Madhya Pradesh's Indore after a 15-day-old infant was sold for ₹5.50 lakh to a Dewas couple. Police said that those arrested include a minor and two accused are currently absconding. The accused bought home appliances with the money they received after selling the infant, which has been recovered from their possession, the police added.

205.title: ₹1 lakh fine imposed on McDonald's outlet in Ahmedabad over pics of dead lizard in drink
205.article_body: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) imposed a penalty of ₹1 lakh on a McDonald's outlet, two weeks after pictures of a dead lizard in a cold drink served by them went viral. The civic body said surprise checks will be conducted for three months. "After paying...fine, the restaurant will be given two days for cleaning up," an official said.

206.title: Bihar will have road network like America by 2024: Nitin Gadkari
206.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said that Bihar will have a road network like America by 2024. He was addressing an event in Hajipur after inaugurating the eastern flank of the renovated Mahatma Gandhi Setu and also laying the foundation stone of road and bridge projects in Bihar worth ₹13,585 crore.

207.title: Unwise to expect everyone to be available every single game: Dravid on Rohit being rested
207.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma being rested too many times after being named all-format captain, India head coach Rahul Dravid said, "Rohit is our all-format player. It'd be unwise to expect everyone to be available every single game...every single time." He added, "We want to ensure...they are fit for the big tournaments." India-South Africa T20I series will begin on Thursday.

208.title: BJYM leader held in Kanpur for objectionable post on Prophet
208.article_body: Four days after violence broke out in UP's Kanpur, Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha leader Harshit Srivastava was arrested on Tuesday evening for his objectionable tweet on Prophet Muhammad. "We will act against anyone who tries to play with religious sentiments," said Kanpur Police Commissioner Vijay Meena. The police lodged a complaint as soon as the post surfaced online.

209.title: Venezuela's Prez Maduro to arrive on 2-day visit to Turkey from Tue
209.article_body: Venezuela's President Nicolás Maduro will arrive in Turkey on a two-day visit from Tuesday, the Turkish government said. Maduro will discuss regional and global matters with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan during the visit. Notably, Turkey has since 2018 increased its exports to Venezuela, including food and personal hygiene products, amid stiff sanctions by the US.

210.title: Japan to open to foreign tourists after 2-year pandemic closure
210.article_body: Japan will reopen to tourists from June 10 after a two-year COVID-19 closure but will require them to wear masks and avail private medical insurance, government said on Tuesday. Tourists will be chaperoned throughout their stay and only visitors on package tours will be allowed entry during first phase of reopening. International students were allowed entry to Japan in March.

211.title: MLA's minor son accused in case of 17-year-old's gangrape in car in Hyderabad
211.article_body: An AIMIM MLA's son has been named as an accused in the gangrape case of a minor girl in a car in Hyderabad, police said on Tuesday. The MLA's son is a minor and has been named as the sixth accused in the case, police said. All accused, including one adult and five minors, are in police custody, reports said.

212.title: China to offer rewards for info about breach of national security
212.article_body: China has announced that it'll offer cash rewards from 10,000 yuan (nearly $1,500) to over 1,00,000 yuan (about $15,000) for tip-offs on breach of national security under measures introduced this week, state media reported. The government will also provide citizens with special certificates. The amount of the reward will be decided on the basis of the value of the tip-off.

213.title: ABD's only ODI golden duck came after 220 matches, 12 years
213.article_body: Ex-South African cricketer AB de Villiers recorded his first and only ODI golden duck in his 221st match (212 innings) on June 7, 2017, over 12 years after his ODI debut. The then South African captain was caught by Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez off Imad Wasim's bowling in a Champions Trophy match. De Villiers registered seven ODI ducks in his career.

214.title: Karthik has been picked in India's squad to bat at backend of game: Dravid
214.article_body: Discussing Dinesh Karthik's role in upcoming T20I series against South Africa, India head coach Rahul Dravid said the wicketkeeper-batter was picked in India's 18-member squad to perform the role of a finisher like he did for RCB in IPL 2022. Karthik scored 330 runs in 16 matches for RCB in this year's IPL at a strike rate of 183.33.

215.title: Ryanair asks UK-bound S African passengers to take language test
215.article_body: Ryanair has mandated UK-bound South African passengers to take a language test in Afrikaans to prove their nationality before travelling. Airline authorities have claimed that the test is an attempt to weed out passengers carrying fraudulent South African passports. Notably, Afrikaans is spoken by 12% of the South African population and was linked to the apartheid era in the country.

216.title: Chhattisgarh is ATM for Congress: BJP on mining at Hasdeo Aranya
216.article_body: Demanding Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo's resignation over the Hasdeo Aranya protests, BJP leader Brijmohan Agrawal criticised Congress and said, "Chhattisgarh is an ATM for the Congress." Agrawal further said that the ruling party 'did not care' about the people of the state. Tribals in Hasdeo Aranya have been protesting against mining inside the area for around 100 days.

217.title: Woman gives birth to identical twins 3 days apart in US, pic surfaces
217.article_body: In a rare occurrence, a woman named Carmen Martinez in Texas gave birth to identical twin daughters three days apart. "They had their own separate placenta and...sac," she said. Martinez said she was advised to delay the birth of her second baby to increase her chance of survival after the first baby was admitted to the NICU after her birth.

218.title: Rajasthan BJP MLA Chandrakanta Meghwal gets notice in 5-yr-old case
218.article_body: The Rajasthan Police has sent a notice to BJP MLA Chandrakanta Meghwal in a five-year-old assault case. Meghwal, who represents the Keshoraipatan assembly constituency, has been asked to appear before the police to cooperate in the investigation. Meghwal is among the BJP MLAs who are camping at a resort in Jaipur ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls.

219.title: 5-yr-old UP girl suspected to have contracted monkeypox tests -ve
219.article_body: A five-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad, who was suspected to have been infected with monkeypox, has tested negative for the virus. The girl's samples had been sent to Pune's ICMR-NIV for testing. So far, no monkeypox case has been reported in the country. CMO Ghaziabad earlier said the girl had complaints of itching and rashes on her body.

220.title: Vietnam arrests Health Minister, Hanoi Mayor over corruption scandal
220.article_body: Vietnam's Health Minister Nguyen Thanh Long and Hanoi Mayor Chu Ngoc Anh were sacked from their roles and arrested following accusations that they were involved in a COVID-19 test-kit corruption scandal. The scandal involved bribery in exchange for supplying hospitals with overpriced kits. Reportedly, their arrests come amid an intensifying anti-corruption drive that was launched in 2016.

221.title: Stop blaming us for your failure: RSS leader on Kerala CM's remark
221.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar criticised Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan for his comments on former BJP leader Nupur Sharma's statement on Prophet Muhammad, saying he should be 'sued for hate speech'. "Pointing fingers at RSS is equivalent to spitting on the sun...the spit falls on your face," Kumar said. Political leaders should 'stop blaming RSS for their own failures', he added.

222.title: SAD alleges threat to ex-minister Bikram Majithia's life in jail
222.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) on Tuesday alleged threat to the life of former minister Bikram Singh Majithia, who is lodged in the Patiala Central Jail in a drugs case. SAD leaders Maheshinder Singh Grewal and Dr Daljit Singh Cheema also alleged that there was a likelihood of Majithia being implicated in another "false" case. Majithia had surrendered on February 24.

223.title: 12 more arrested in Kanpur violence, total 50 arrests made: Police
223.article_body: Police have arrested 12 more people in connection with Kanpur violence, taking the total number of arrests made to 50, an official said. DCP (East) Pramod Kumar said that a 16-year-old boy surrendered after his picture appeared on posters put up by the police. Violence erupted in parts of Kanpur on Friday in protest against "insulting comments" on Prophet Muhammad.

224.title: Ukraine will fight for all its territory, stalemate no option: Prez
224.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Tuesday that the country will fight to recover all its territory occupied by Russian forces, adding that stalemate is "not an option". "We have already lost too many people to simply cede our territory...We have to achieve...full deoccupation," he added. Russian forces have been fighting in eastern Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk to seize power.

225.title: I wasn't the favourite in French Open 2022 quarters vs Djokovic: Nadal
225.article_body: Rafael Nadal said world number one Novak Djokovic was the favourite to win their quarter-final match at the recently concluded French Open. "Normally it would have gone differently, but it's true that this place has something special," he added. Nadal, who won French Open for the record-extending 14th time on Sunday, defeated Djokovic 6-2, 4-6, 6-2, 7-6(7-4) in the last-eight.

226.title: 'Waited over 1hr for wheelchair at Delhi airport', says para swimmer; Air India replies
226.article_body: Para swimmer Shams Aalam said he had to wait for over an hour at Delhi airport to get his personal wheelchair after flying on an Air India flight. "I need to use washroom no one supporting," said Aalam on Twitter. After he got the wheelchair, Air India tweeted, "It took some time...as it got delayed due to airport security reasons."

227.title: Man ends life after losing borrowed ₹17,000 in online game in MP
227.article_body: A 23-year-old man in Madhya Pradesh's Indore died by suicide after he lost borrowed ₹17,000 in an online ludo game. The man, Basant Devidas Gavale, was the only son in the family and left a suicide note in which he wrote, "Whatever I am doing, I am doing it voluntarily." Gavale had asked his boss for the money.

228.title: 40-yr-old priest found dead in temple in Raj, idol missing
228.article_body: A 40-year-old priest was found dead and the idol of a deity was reported missing from inside a temple in Rajasthan's Bundi, police said on Tuesday. It is likely that the priest was killed while protecting the idol, said Additional Superintendent of Police (Bundi) Kishori Lal. It is believed that there were two or more attackers, SP Jai Yadav said.

229.title: Sri Lanka to get $55 million loan from India to buy fertilisers
229.article_body: A Sri Lankan official on Tuesday said that Sri Lanka will take a $55 million loan from India to buy fertilisers. The country is currently dealing with a severe economic crisis that has sparked a rise in food prices and also caused food shortages. The decision has been taken ahead of the 'Maha' harvest season in the country.

230.title: Big B liked idea of ancient astras in modern world: Brahmāstra director
230.article_body: 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji has stated that veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has always liked the idea of ancient Indian astras in the modern world. The director added, "Mr Bachchan...told me that the concept will work with people." Ayan further said that whoever was approached for the film came on board, be it Alia Bhatt, Nagarjuna Akkineni or Amitabh Bachchan.

231.title: 46-yr-old man arrested for 3 bomb blasts in Manipur's Imphal
231.article_body: Police said a 46-year-old man, Thounaojam Rishi Luwangcha, was arrested in connection with three low-intensity blasts in and around Manipur's Imphal in recent weeks. Imphal West District Superintendent of Police (SP) Ksh Shivakanta Singh said explosives, detonators and cordtex wires were seized from him. Luwangcha said he was paid ₹30,000 for each blast by an armed group, police added.

232.title: Jealous of son, people congratulating me for him not 'Rocketry': Madhavan
232.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has said in an interview that he is "really jealous" of his son Vedaant right now. The actor added, "Every time I meet people...I think that they are coming up to me with a smile because I think they are congratulating me for 'Rocketry' but then they say, 'He not really got the silver but gold'."

233.title: Always nice to play in India against India: SA batter Miller
233.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller said his side are aware that the upcoming five-match T20I series against India will be a challenging one as the hosts have serious match-winners in their team. "It's always nice to play in India against India. Hopefully...we can beat team," he added. The first T20I will be played in Delhi on June 9.

234.title: Man shares pic of fish caught in Russia, Instagram user says 'Looks like a Pokémon'
234.article_body: A deep-sea fisherman shared an image of a creature dubbed 'Frankenstein's fish'. It was shared by Roman Fedortsov, a trawlerman stationed near port city of Murmansk, Russia. The picture shows a translucent white fish, with sunken green eyes and fins that look like torn wings. "Looks like a Pokémon," a comment read while another person wrote, "It...looks like anime eyes."

235.title: 21-yr-old Suved Parkar records 5th highest score on debut in first-class cricket history
235.article_body: Mumbai's 21-year-old middle-order batter Suved Parkar recorded the fifth-highest score on debut in first-class cricket history. Parkar scored 252(447) in the first innings of his team's Ranji Trophy quarter-final against Uttarakhand. Bihar's Sakibul Gani holds the record for the highest score on first-class debut with 341, followed by Ajay Rohera (267*), Amol Muzumdar (260) and Bahir Shah (256*).

236.title: I've practically grown up in BJP, accept & respect its decision: Nupur on suspension
236.article_body: BJP's former National Spokesperson Nupur Sharma, who was suspended from BJP over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, said she 'respects and accepts' the party's decision. "I have practically grown up in the organisation," said Sharma. At least 15 nations have condemned the remarks with some seeking a public apology over remarks by Sharma and another ex-BJP leader Naveen Jindal.

237.title: I didn't want to enter films, wanted job with regular pay: Kajol
237.article_body: Actress Kajol has revealed that she had never wanted to join the film industry. The actress said, "I always wanted a job that would give me a regular pay cheque every month. That's the kind of job I had wanted." In an earlier interview, Kajol had said that she didn't think the money in films was worth the effort.

238.title: 28-yr-old man kills father after an argument in J&K, arrested
238.article_body: Police said that a 28-year-old man murdered his father after an argument in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district. Accused Joginder Kumar attacked his father in his sleep with a hammer, a police official said, adding that the victim died on the spot. A police team rushed to the spot on getting information and arrested the accused, the official said.

239.title: Focus on building organisation first: Nadda to Andhra BJP leaders
239.article_body: Addressing BJP leaders in Andhra Pradesh, party National President JP Nadda asked the leaders to first focus on building the organisation from the ground level in the state rather than worrying about political alliances. "Remember, we have BJP governments in 18 states, apart from the Centre...We have a strategy for Andhra Pradesh and will do whatever is required," Nadda said.

240.title: Kerala CM, his wife & daughter involved in gold smuggling: Main accused Swapna Suresh
240.article_body: The prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, on Tuesday claimed CM Pinarayi Vijayan, his wife Kamala and daughter Veena were involved in the scam. Suresh further said Vijayan's additional private secretary CM Raveendran, then Principal Secretary Nalini Netto and then minister KT Jaleel were also involved. "I've filed a petition seeking protection in the court," she added.

241.title: Kanpur DM Neha Sharma transferred days after violence, Vishak Iyer to replace her
241.article_body: Kanpur Nagar District Magistrate Neha Sharma has been transferred to Local Bodies Department of Uttar Pradesh, days after violence broke out in the district. She will be replaced by CMO Special Secretary Vishak G Iyer. The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday announced the transfer of a total of 21 IAS officers. Last month, the state government transferred 16 IAS officers.

242.title: Magic show held for Rajasthan Cong MLAs in resort ahead of RS polls
242.article_body: A magic show was organised for Rajasthan Congress MLAs who are staying in a resort amid poaching fears ahead of the June 10 Rajya Sabha polls. Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot was also present there during the show held on Monday. The Congress had shifted its legislators to Udaipur on June 2.

243.title: UK seeks probe into alleged Ukraine grain theft by Russia amid war
243.article_body: UK's Farming Minister Victoria Prentis on Tuesday called for an immediate investigation into allegations that Russia has been stealing grain from Ukraine. Prentis, who termed the allegations 'very serious', said that she has heard reports of grain theft in southern Ukraine's Kherson region. Ukraine is unable to export wheat supplies due to the Russian blockade of its Black Sea ports.

244.title: We'd want to get best out of Hardik's skills: Dravid ahead of T20Is vs SA
244.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said the side would want to get the best out of all-rounder Hardik Pandya's batting, bowling and fielding skills ahead of five-match T20I series against South Africa. "Hardik's leadership was impressive right through the IPL," he added. Hardik-led GT won IPL 2022 title in their debut season. First T20I to be played on Thursday.

245.title: Ricky Kej's Grammy medallion, stuck in Bengaluru customs, cleared after 2 months
245.article_body: Grammy-winning Indian composer Ricky Kej sought the help of authorities to expedite the clearance of his Grammy medallion. Kej claimed it was stuck with customs department in Bengaluru for over two months. A few hours later, he tweeted, "Thanks to the quick, swift intervention by the Customs of India, my medallion has cleared customs and will be delivered tomorrow."

246.title: Apple to change iPhone connector as EU agrees to single charging port
246.article_body: Apple will have to change the connector on iPhones sold in Europe by 2024 after EU countries on Tuesday agreed to a single mobile charging port for mobile phones, tablets and cameras. European Commission said the decision would make consumers' lives easier and help them save money. "By autumn 2024, USB Type-C will become the common charging port," EU said.

247.title: Who are UP-born billionaire Gupta brothers arrested in UAE on corruption charges?
247.article_body: Rajesh Gupta and Atul Gupta of the wealthy Gupta family were arrested in Dubai on Tuesday for corruption in South Africa. The UP-born brothers had multiple businesses in South Africa including IT, media, mining etc. They enjoyed close ties with former South African President Jacob Zuma and allegedly benefited financially from them. They're also accused of fraud and money laundering.

248.title: Frustrated & angry: Biocon chief on poor condition of B'luru roads
248.article_body: Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw recently said she was "frustrated and angry at the lack of responsibility of the MLA, Panchayat and MP of Bengaluru's Anekal taluk and Huskur Gram Panchayat at the Huskur-Sarjapur road's abominable condition". "Why does the government build bus depot and quarters with no road to support it? Shame on all the local politicians," Kiran added.

249.title: Teacher, 22-yr-old student held for molesting minor boys in Kerala
249.article_body: A teacher and a 22-year-old student of an institution, imparting religious education in Kerala's Kannur, have been arrested in a POCSO case for allegedly molesting three minor boys, who went there for religious studies. The parents got to know about the incident when the kids refused to go to school after vacations, an officer said.

250.title: German Foreign Minister tests +ve for COVID during trip to Pakistan
250.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Tuesday tested positive for coronavirus during her trip to Pakistan. Baerbock took a COVID-19 test after she noticed that she had lost her sense of taste during lunch today, the German Foreign Ministry said. Notably, Baerbock had met Pakistan's Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari earlier in the day.

251.title: Didn't care on tying, don't care now when I'm 2 up: Nadal on Grand Slam race
251.article_body: Commenting on who will end up with most Grand Slams following his 22nd Slam at French Open 2022, which has put him two clear of Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal stated anything can happen. "I didn't care when we were tied and I don't care now when I'm two up. I just want to keep competing," he added.

252.title: World Bank cuts global growth forecast to 2.9%, warns of stagflation
252.article_body: World Bank on Tuesday cut its global growth forecast for 2022 by 1.2 percentage points to 2.9% and warned of stagflation. It said the Russia-Ukraine war has compounded damage from COVID-19 pandemic, with many countries likely to face recession. World Bank President David Malpass said such a period of weak growth and high inflation was last seen in the 1970s.

253.title: YSRCP hires I-PAC again ahead of 2024 Andhra Assembly polls
253.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's ruling YSRCP has hired political strategist Prashant Kishor's Indian Political Action Committee (I-PAC) for a second time ahead of 2024 state Assembly polls, a party leader has confirmed. "Kishor's colleague...Rishi Raj Singh [along with I-PAC's team] will be working for...YSRCP till...next elections," the leader added. YSRCP won 151 out of 175 seats in 2019 state Assembly polls.

254.title: Govt working at grassroots level for welfare of tribal society: Shah
254.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that the government is working at the grassroots level for the welfare of tribal society. After inaugurating the National Tribal Research Institute in Delhi, Shah said that the NTRI will work to realise PM Narendra Modi's vision of "connecting the diversity of tribal societies and other tribal institutions running across the country."

255.title: No batter likes to face 150 kmph ball: Bavuma on facing Umran ahead of T20Is
255.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa T20I series, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma praised Umran Malik, saying he's an "exciting pace bowling prospect" for Team India. Talking about possibly facing Umran, who consistently bowled over 150 kmph in the recently concluded IPL 2022, Bavuma said no batter wants to face a ball at 150 kmph. First T20I will be played on Thursday.

256.title: Mumbai's daily COVID-19 cases rise to 1,242, positivity rate at 7.24%
256.article_body: Mumbai on Tuesday reported 1,242 fresh COVID-19 cases, compared to 676 cases recorded on Monday. The city saw 506 recoveries and zero deaths in the last 24 hours, while the number of active cases stands at 5,974. The positivity rate dropped to 7.24% from Monday's 9.8%. As many as 74 patients were hospitalised on Tuesday.

257.title: Govt widens CDS selection pool; serving or retd 3-star officers eligible
257.article_body: The Centre has issued three separate notifications amending the rules of Army, Navy and Air Force for the appointment of the next Chief of Defence Staff (CDS). Any serving or retired Lieutenant General, Air Marshal and Vice Admiral under the age of 62 years will be eligible for the post. The post is lying vacant since General Bipin Rawat's death.

258.title: Imran Khan's party carried out 'suicide attacks' against Pak: Ex-PM
258.article_body: Former Pakistani PM and PML(N) leader Shahid Khaqan Abbasi has accused ex-PM Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) of being responsible for "suicide attacks" against the country. "The decisions [PTI] made...last month...[and] the manner in which they breached the IMF deal...were...suicide attacks," Abbasi said. He also accused Khan's administration of neglecting Pakistan's energy sector.

259.title: 2 people dead after shooting in German supermarket: Police
259.article_body: Two people were found dead after a shooting in a supermarket in central Germany on Tuesday, the police said. There was no danger to the public, the police added. Witnesses reported that a man shot a woman in the supermarket and immediately afterward apparently killed himself, according to a police statement.

260.title: India's FY23 economic growth forecast cut to 7.5% by World Bank
260.article_body: The World Bank on Tuesday cut India's FY23 economic growth forecast to 7.5% from 8% estimated earlier in April. It cut the forecast due to "headwinds from rising inflation, supply chain disruptions, and geopolitical tensions offsetting buoyancy in the recovery of services consumption from the pandemic". World Bank had trimmed the projection for India from 8.7% to 8% in April.

261.title: Govt proposes panel to override decisions of social media firms in new draft IT rules
261.article_body: In a new draft of its Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines & Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021, the government has proposed a committee with powers to override the decisions of all social media companies. The proposed Grievance Appellate Committee will be able to veto the decisions of grievance officers of intermediaries. The government will hold public consultations in mid-June.

262.title: My mom Tanuja was always scolding me while growing up: Kajol
262.article_body: Actress Kajol has revealed that her mother veteran actress Tanuja was always scolding her when she was growing up. Kajol further said, "She would always be lost in her own world. And if you tell her something, she would stare at you with her big eyes." The actress added that she was scared of her mother growing up.

263.title: 3 arrested for selling drugs on a fake e-commerce site in Gujarat
263.article_body: The Anti-Terrorism Squad of Gujarat said they arrested three men from Ahmedabad on Monday for selling narcotics and psychotropic substances through a fake e-commerce website. An ATS officer said that the accused sent the drugs in boxes used by a leading e-commerce company and used encrypted text messages to cover their tracks.

264.title: US, S Korea & Japan fly fighter jets amid tensions with N Korea
264.article_body: The US, South Korea and Japan on Tuesday flew fighter jets in two separate exercises over waters surrounding the Korean Peninsula amid tension with North Korea. Notably, warplanes were flown amid US Deputy Secretary of State Wendy Sherman's visit to South Korea. Sherman arrived in Seoul to discuss actions by North Korea, including a possibly imminent North Korean nuclear test.

265.title: Skye Air Mobility begins drone trials for medicine delivery in Kerala
265.article_body: New Delhi-based drone startup Skye Air Mobility, along with Aster DM Healthcare, has initiated trials for delivering essential medicines and critical lab samples from Kozhikode to Areekode in Kerala using drones. A statement read that the medicinal supplies will be delivered across approximately 30 kilometers. After completion of the five-day trial, Skye Air aims to undertake about 50 flights.

266.title: PM after AAP, but God's with us: Kejriwal on ED raids against Jain
266.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) found ₹2.85 crore in cash and gold coins weighing 1.8 kg after raiding Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain and his aides' premises, CM Arvind Kejriwal said "The PM is after AAP with all his power." "You [PM] have the power of all the agencies, but God is with us," the AAP chief added.

267.title: Terrorists involved in Kulgam bank manager's murder identified: IGP
267.article_body: Inspector General of Police Kashmir Vijay Kumar on Tuesday said that terrorists involved in the murder of a bank manager in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam have been identified and will be neutralised soon. The victim, who hailed from Rajasthan's Hanumangarh, was shot dead inside bank on June 2. His murder was the eighth targeted killing in Kashmir since May 1.

268.title: Root has gone far ahead of Kohli, Smith, Williamson: Karim
268.article_body: On being asked if Joe Root is ahead of Virat Kohli, Steve Smith and Kane Williamson based on his performance, Saba Karim said the England batter has gone "far" ahead of the other three batters in the last two years. Root recently became the 14th player in cricket history and second England player to complete 10,000 runs in Tests.

269.title: Suspected Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist arrested from Bengaluru
269.article_body: A suspected Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist has been arrested from Bengaluru's Okalipuram in a joint operation by Jammu and Kashmir Police and Indian Army's Rashtriya Rifles. According to officials, the accused had been living in the city for past two years. The suspect was allegedly involved in recruitment of cadre and was part of terror conspiracies in Kashmir, police said.

270.title: Gurugram man arrested for posing as Lawrence Bishnoi gang member
270.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested on Tuesday for posing as a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang and making a threat call to the chairman of a private school in Gurugram, police said. Upset over failing his class 10th examination in 2019, the accused threatened to kidnap and murder the chairman of Guru Dronacharya School JP Yadav, Gurugram Police said.

271.title: Pune court sends man held for Lashkar-e-Taiba links to judicial custody
271.article_body: A Pune court on Tuesday sent Mohammed Junaid Mohammed Ata, who was arrested for his alleged involvement in funding and recruitment for Lashkar-e-Taiba, to judicial custody. The 28-year-old had been working at a scrap dealer shop in Dapodi. The Maharashtra Anti Terrorism Squad (ATS) had arrested him on May 23.

272.title: I pity women in your life: Swara to troll saying 'Amber deserved that'
272.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker reacted to a troll who tweeted, "I like you but Heard deserved that," after she shared an article about the Amber Heard-Johnny Depp defamation case. She responded, "Nobody deserves to be sexually assaulted...I pity the women in your life." Swara also shared a 2020 article on Depp losing his libel case against The Sun's "wife-beater" claim.

273.title: College student fights off robber who molested her on Mumbai train
273.article_body: A 20-year-old college student fought her molester off and got him arrested after he tried to rob her inside a local train in Mumbai on Monday. The accused had boarded the ladies' compartment and tried to snatch the woman's bag when she was waiting to get off the train. In the scuffle, both of them fell off the stationary train.

274.title: 23 K'taka students suspended for staging protest to wear hijab
274.article_body: The Uppinangady Government First Grade College management suspended 23 girl students, who staged a protest demanding permission to wear hijab inside classrooms last week. The Karnataka High Court in March stated that the hijab isn't an essential religious practice in Islam, making it mandatory for everyone to wear uniforms provided by the educational institutions.

275.title: Ukraine must not be pressured into a bad peace deal, says UK PM
275.article_body: British PM Boris Johnson has said that Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy must not be pressured by world powers into accepting a bad peace deal with Russian President Vladimir Putin. The world must avoid any outcome where Putin's unwarranted aggression appears to have paid off, he added. Johnson also said that Britain would "remain at the forefront" of support for Ukraine.

276.title: Delhi Metro extends train timings for India-SA T20 match spectators
276.article_body: Delhi Metro has extended timings of last trains on all lines except the Airport Express Line to facilitate spectators during the India-South Africa T20 match. Delhi Metro will be performing nearly 48 extra trips by extending its last trains' timings by about 30-45 minutes on June 9. Last train on Violet Line from Kashmere Gate will start at 12:00 am.

277.title: Delhi Police bust illegal arms gang, seize 10 country-made pistols
277.article_body: The Special Cell of Delhi Police busted an illegal arms gang and arrested one person, said an official release on Tuesday. Police recovered five semi-automatic pistols, 10 country-made pistols and four live cartridges from his possession. The gang is involved in supplying illegal arms and ammunition in Delhi-NCR and Western Uttar Pradesh, according to the Delhi Police.

278.title: Salman's statement recorded over death threat letter, actor denies dispute with anyone
278.article_body: Mumbai Police has recorded the statement of actor Salman Khan in connection with a letter threatening him and his father, an official said on Tuesday. In his statement, he denied threat from any person, threat calls or a dispute with anyone in the recent past. Police had earlier enhanced the security around the actor's residence in Bandra.

279.title: Theme park exclusively for women, kids inaugurated in Hyderabad
279.article_body: A theme park built exclusively for women and children has been inaugurated at Kukatpally Housing Board Colony (KPHB)-Phase 3 in Hyderabad. Only women and children under the age of 10 years are allowed in the park. It has dedicated play areas for children, an open gym, walking paths, a yoga space and an area exclusively marked for kitty parties.

280.title: YouTuber Roddur Roy arrested for 'derogatory' remarks against Mamata
280.article_body: YouTuber Roddur Roy was arrested in Goa on Tuesday for allegedly making derogatory remarks against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Roy will be brought to Kolkata on transit remand, a senior police official said. He had reportedly made the remarks during a Facebook live programme, following which TMC spokesperson Riju Dutta had filed a complaint against him.

281.title: Request media not to associate public appeal with us: Sidhu's family
281.article_body: Late Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's family has requested the media not to associate any public appeals with them amid his murder investigation. "Whatever appeal will be made on behalf of Sidhu's family will be done via his official Instagram handle," their statement read in Punjabi. Sidhu was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on May 29.

282.title: Bicycle thief arrested in Navi Mumbai, 25 stolen bicycles seized
282.article_body: The Panvel city police arrested a 35-year-old bicycle thief and recovered over 25 stolen bicycles from him. Police said the accused, Dinesh Ramdas Jadhav, was a porter in a market and started stealing bicycles to make extra money. A team under Senior Inspector Vijay Kadbane worked on the modus operandi and with a tip-off, arrested the accused, the police said.

283.title: Mumbai won't flood even if it rains at 60-70 mm/hour: BMC official
283.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Additional Municipal Commissioner P Velrasu has said that even if Mumbai receives rain at the rate of 60 to 70 mm per hour, there will be no waterlogging. However, if the rainfall exceeds this limit, there will be flooding, he added. BMC has dealt with 73% of flooding spots in the city, Velrasu said.

284.title: CBIC to destroy 42,000 kgs of narcotics across 14 locations on Wed
284.article_body: The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has announced that it'll destroy about 42,000 kilograms of narcotics as part of its 'Drug Destruction Day' on Wednesday. The narcotics will be destroyed across 14 locations in the country. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will virtually witness the destruction in Guwahati, Lucknow, Mumbai, Mundra, Kandla, Patna and Siliguri.

285.title: Delhi to witness ongoing heatwave till June 9: IMD
285.article_body: Delhi will witness the ongoing heatwave at isolated places till June 9 and the temperature will remain between 44-46°C, IMD Senior Scientist RK Jenamani said. Cloudy conditions and drizzle is expected on June 11 over northwest India and parts of central India due to a western disturbance. He added that the heatwave will abate from June 11.

286.title: Nitin Gadkari, other Union ministers seen in bus at Patna airport
286.article_body: Union minister Nitin Gadkari's office took to Twitter to share a picture of him sitting in a bus at Patna's Jay Prakash Narayan International Airport, along with Union ministers Ashwini Kumar Choubey and Shandilya Giriraj Singh, among others. Gadkari is on a one-day visit to Bihar. Bihar Deputy CMs Tarkishore Prasad and Renu Devi were also seen in the picture.

287.title: Man shoots estranged wife dead in alimony dispute in Pune
287.article_body: A 45-year-old man allegedly shot dead his estranged wife and injured his mother-in-law following a dispute over alimony in Pune district's Shirur, police said on Tuesday. The accused, Dipak Dhawale, who travelled to Shirur for a court hearing, opened fire at the victim and her mother. Dhawale fled in an auto after the shooting but was nabbed by police.

288.title: Man destroys ₹40 cr in rare museum artifacts after fight with girlfriend in US
288.article_body: A 21-year-old man in US broke into the Dallas Museum of Art and destroyed ancient antiquities worth a total of $5 million (around ₹40.37 crore) after a fight with his girlfriend, police said. A sixth-century Greek statue and a pot dating back to 450 BC were among items destroyed by Brian Hernandez. He was caught smashing them using a stool.

289.title: Maharashtra Board to announce Class 12 result at 1 pm tomorrow
289.article_body: The Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education will announce the Class 12 result on Wednesday. Minister for School Education Varsha Gaikwad said the result will be declared at 1 pm. After the online examination for the last two years due to COVID-19, students appeared for the exam offline this year.

290.title: COVID trying to crawl back into our lives: Sonnalli on testing +ve
290.article_body: Actress Sonnalli Seygall announced on Tuesday that she tested positive for COVID-19. She wrote in a social media post, "Finally after 2 yrs I have contracted the virus. I am isolating and recovering. This msg is also a reminder that covid is trying to crawl back into our lives, so mask up guys!" Earlier, actor Kartik Aaryan tested COVID-19 positive.

291.title: Want to see who's selling golgappas in train: Sanjay Gupta on 'Laal..' scene
291.article_body: Talking about a scene where Aamir Khan can be seen eating a golgappa in the trailer of his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', director Sanjay Gupta tweeted, "I'm dying to see...who is selling golgappas in a moving train." 'Laal Singh Chaddha' is a remake of Tom Hanks' 1994 American film 'Forrest Gump' and also stars Kareena Kapoor, Naga Chaitanya, Sharman Joshi.

292.title: Wanted to build something from scratch: Stoinis on signing for LSG in IPL
292.article_body: Revealing the "big reason" behind signing for debutants LSG in IPL 2022, all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said he wanted to build something from scratch. "Have a blank canvas to work with, in...company of someone like KL Rahul and Sanjiv Goenka to build something that you can look back on in 10-15 years," he added. LSG lost in the Eliminator to RCB.

293.title: Diljit offered me Honsla Rakh, Shehnaaz ended up doing it: Nimrit Kaur Ahluwalia
293.article_body: Nimrit Kaur Ahluwalia revealed that she was offered a role in Diljit Dosanjh-starrer 'Honsla Rakh' while she was working on the show 'Choti Sarrdaarni'. "It was Diljit sir who'd reached out himself...He texted me...and asked if I'd test for a part," she said, adding, "Shehnaaz (Gill) ended up doing it...Lot of things didn't work out, COVID was at its peak."

294.title: Ukraine must demine its coast for grain to be exported: Russia
294.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said Ukraine must demine the approaches to its ports in order for ships to be cleared by Russian military before they could export grain, Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters. Russia has blockaded Ukrainian ports, disrupting the export of grains from Ukraine. Earlier, Ukraine accused Russia of stealing grain from occupied areas and selling it.

295.title: Right now he is Australia's best T20I fast bowler: Watson on Hazlewood
295.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson named Josh Hazlewood as Australia's best T20I pacer currently, saying it's amazing to see his evolution as a T20I bowler over the last two years. "Always thought he was just a Test and one-day bowler because he didn't have that many defensive options in T20 cricket," he added. Hazlewood has taken 40 T20I wickets so far.

296.title: Fan in Lalu Yadav's room in Jharkhand catches fire, none injured
296.article_body: A fire broke out in a room of the circuit house in Jharkhand's Palamu where RJD chief and former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav was staying, officials said. Prasad was having breakfast in his room when the fan caught fire due to a short circuit, they added. The fire was immediately doused by his aides and no one sustained injuries.

297.title: Prophet remarks not made by any govt functionary, no impact on govt: Goyal
297.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said that remarks against Prophet Muhammad by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma do not have any impact on the government. "I don't think that this statement was made by any government functionary and therefore it has no impact on the government and necessary action has been taken by the party," Goyal added.

298.title: Number of Left Wing Extremism-hit districts down by 70% since 2014: Shah
298.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that the number of districts affected by Left Wing Extremism (LWE) has declined by 70% since 2014. "The government also lifted the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA) from more than 66% [of the] area in the Northeast," he added. Separately, Shah inaugurated the National Tribal Research Institute (NTRI) in Delhi today.

299.title: 2 killed, 1 severely injured after house wall collapses in Gujarat
299.article_body: Two people died and one was severely injured after the wall of an old dilapidated house collapsed on them in Gujarat's Sabarkantha district. The incident occurred on Tuesday when Babu Patel was getting his new residence constructed adjacent to his old house. While Babu and 28-year-old labourer Harsh Barada were declared dead, the other labourer suffered injuries, an official said.

300.title: 133 gold coins, ₹2.8cr cash found in raid on Delhi minister & his aide; pics released
300.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it has found 133 gold coins weighing 1.8 kg and ₹2.85 crore in cash during a raid conducted on the premises of arrested Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain and his aide. The seized cash and gold were acquired from unexplained sources, ED said. Various incriminating documents and digital records were also found, it added.

301.title: Artefacts from Ukraine invasion displayed at museum in Kyiv
301.article_body: Artefacts recovered from ongoing Russian military offensive in Ukraine are being shown to visitors at a museum in Kyiv. Items including missiles, food rations and helmets, along with personal notes and credit cards of Russian soldiers killed on the frontlines have been put on display. "You can see and touch the war with your fingertips here," curator Yuriy Savchuk said.

302.title: Originally planned to have wedding with Nayanthara in Tirupati: Vignesh
302.article_body: Filmmaker Vignesh Shivan said that he and actress Nayanthara had originally planned their wedding to be held in Tirupati. "We were even ready to make arrangements, but we felt it won't work out logistically. Therefore, we decided to have it in Chennai. It's a close-knit ceremony with family members and close friends," he added.

303.title: Noida Police rescues 2 girls from Jharkhand trafficked as housemaids
303.article_body: Two minor sisters who were trafficked as housemaids in Noida have been rescued by the police, officials said on Monday. Notably, a couple in Noida had employed them through an agency. "The police had inputs that the girls were kept as slaves and forcefully made to work in the household...after which the action was taken," a police spokesperson said.

304.title: Chennai woman kills self after losing money in online gambling
304.article_body: A 29-year-old woman died by suicide in Chennai on Sunday after she allegedly lost money on an online gaming platform. According to the police, the woman, Bhavani, had a habit of playing online rummy for the past one-and-a-half years and had begun investing more in past four months after initially earning profit. She had reportedly lost over ₹10 lakh.

305.title: Policybazaar-owner PB Fintech shares crash over 15% on CEO's stake sale plan
305.article_body: Shares of PB Fintech, which owns Policybazaar, crashed over 15% in Tuesday’s intraday trade after its CEO Yashish Dahiya proposed to sell around 37 lakh shares through the open market. The shares hit an intraday low of ₹557 on the BSE, 15.4% down from its previous close, while on NSE it touched ₹556, 15.6% down from its previous close.

306.title: For 15 days after heart surgery, I became extremely humble: Sunil Grover
306.article_body: Actor Sunil Grover stated that he became extremely humble and full of gratitude for 15 days after his heart surgery, having suffered a heart attack. "I had become very sweet," added Sunil. Discussing the lessons he has learnt, Sunil stated, "If you can drink water when you want [and] sit up on your bed by yourself, you are lucky."

307.title: Talk isn't a problem, casteism is: Dalit activist after Google cancels her talk
307.article_body: Dalit rights activist Thenmozhi Soundararajan, whose talk on caste bias was cancelled by Google, said a talk on casteism isn't the problem, casteism itself is. "Every part of Google's reaction (to the talk) reflects that they need to do caste equity," Soundararajan said. "I just wish Google had given us the chance to show them the other way," she added.

308.title: K'taka BJP will face 2023 polls under collective leadership: Yediyurappa
308.article_body: BJP leader and former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Tuesday said the 2023 Assembly elections in the state will be fought under 'collective leadership'. "As voters are with PM Narendra Modi and...BJP, there will be no hurdles in our path towards victory," he said. Yediyurappa added that he is committed to travelling across the state to strengthen the party.

309.title: Inclusion is firm foundation underlying our constitutional architecture: VP Naidu
309.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu said that underlying our constitutional architecture is the firm foundation of "inclusion", of leaving no one behind. "It is the vision that finds an echo in the overarching philosophy of the present government, led by Prime Minister Modi that believes in 'sabka sath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas and sabka prayas'," he added.

310.title: Man from Tamil Nadu held for threatening to blow up 6 RSS offices
310.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has arrested a man from Tamil Nadu for threatening to blow up at least six RSS offices, including two in Uttar Pradesh. The ATS will bring the suspect to Lucknow on transit remand. A man associated with RSS was added to a WhatsApp group, where a discussion regarding the bomb blasts was underway, police said.

311.title: Man who disguised himself as Moosewala's fan & clicked selfie among 8 arrested
311.article_body: Punjab Police have arrested 8 people so far in connection with murder of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. A man who disguised himself as a fan and clicked selfies with Sidhu Moosewala and shared information with the shooters has also been arrested. SIT has also identified four shooters of Sidhu Moosewala.

312.title: NCW takes cognisance of Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case
312.article_body: National Commission for Women Chairperson Rekha Sharma on Tuesday said that the commission has taken cognisance of Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case. A 17-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped when she was returning home after a party in the Jubilee Hills area on May 28. "The matter is serious because minor girls are being targeted," she said.

313.title: Amije Forever Tomar: Kartik as 'Bhool...' crosses ₹200-cr mark globally
313.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, taking to Instagram on Monday, shared box office figures of his latest film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. In his post, he mentioned that the horror-comedy film has earned more than ₹200 crore at the worldwide box office and ₹154.82 crore in the Indian market. "Amije Forever Tomar (I am forever yours)," Kartik wrote.

314.title: Russian envoy walks out of UN meeting as EU blames Moscow for food crisis
314.article_body: Russia's UN ambassador walked out of a UN Security Council meeting after European Council President Charles Michel blamed Moscow's invasion of Ukraine for causing a global food crisis. Michel said Russia's using food supplies as "stealth missile against developing countries". "You may leave the room, maybe it's easier not to listen to...truth," Michel told Vassily Nebenzia as he walked out.

315.title: Not afraid: Mamata on terrorist group KLO chief's reported threats
315.article_body: After banned terrorist group Kamatapur Liberation Organization (KLO) chief reportedly threatened West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee with a "bloodbath" if she opposed the group's demand for a separate state, she responded by saying, "Some people are threatening me, I'm not afraid." In a purported video message to Banerjee, KLO chief had said, "Beware. Don't step on the soil of Kamatapur."

316.title: Chaddis do chaddi work: Ex-K'taka CM Siddaramaiah on RSS
316.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised RSS saying "chaddis do chaddi work" and asked why the post of the organisation's chief has never been occupied by a Dalit. "I am telling you from the beginning that RSS is a non-secular organisation," he said. Siddaramaiah is talking about such things because he doesn't have any other subject, said Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai.

317.title: Pakistan asks Qatar for more LNG amid fuel crisis: Report
317.article_body: Pakistan has asked Qatar for additional shipments of Liquified Natural Gas (LNG) amid its ongoing fuel crunch, Bloomberg has reported quoting sources. This comes amid recent reports that the Pakistani government was mulling reducing the number of working days in a bid to conserve fuel and foreign exchange. Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves have reportedly fallen below $10 billion.

318.title: Ajay shares fans' comments for 'Legend of Bhagat...' on film's 20th anniversary
318.article_body: Ajay Devgn on Tuesday marked the 20th anniversary of 'The Legend of Bhagat Singh' by sharing a series of fan comments about the film on his Instagram account. "This movie will always be close to my heart," a fan wrote, while another commented, "Got...tears while watching...[it]." "Even after 20 years...#TheLegendOfBhagatSingh remains a film...I'm proud to have associated with," Ajay wrote.

319.title: SEBI may use US casinos-like AI tech against insider trading: Report
319.article_body: SEBI is in talks with a US-based AI firm to develop Vegas casinos-like AI tech to catch insider trading, Economic Times reported citing sources. If the deal goes through, the company will customise the software according to the requirements of SEBI. The company has given a live demonstration to SEBI as to how the software will work.

320.title: Congress aims to politicise textbook issue: K’taka Education Minister
320.article_body: Amid the textbook issue in the state, Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said Congress aims to "politicise" the textbook issue for elections. "For the last 65 years, they were teaching false things to the students," Nagesh added. "Congress, everyday, is coming down. Whatever false agenda they have given to the people, it is coming out now," he stated.

321.title: Cong burning RSS chaddi as theirs has been stripped: Pralhad Joshi
321.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Tuesday said Congress is "burning RSS chaddi (knicker)...because people have stripped [Congress'] chaddis". This comes after Congress' youth wing NSUI set fire to a pair of RSS knickers to protest against "saffronisation" of school textbooks in Karnataka. People have taken Congress' chaddis off in front of the entire country in Uttar Pradesh, Joshi added.

322.title: 1 booked for insulting national flag ahead of Kejriwal's Guj rally
322.article_body: Police have registered an FIR against an unidentified person for allegedly insulting the national flag ahead of AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's roadshow in Gujarat. A video has surfaced in which the accused was purportedly seen putting his feet on the Tricolour on a roadside, where some flags were kept for distribution to AAP supporters, police said.

323.title: Syria claims Israel fired missiles at its military sites
323.article_body: Syria has claimed that Israeli forces fired multiple missiles at its military sites south of Damascus. It added that the attack caused some material damage but there were no casualties as it shot down most of the missiles. UK-based war monitor Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said that the missiles targeted sites where pro-Iran Shiite militias are located.

324.title: Man pushes woman onto subway tracks; New York Police shares video
324.article_body: New York Police Department (NYPD) has shared a video on Twitter showing a man pushing a 52-year-old woman onto the subway tracks in the Bronx. The suspect is still at large and NYPD has offered up to $3,500 (₹2,71,932) to anyone who can give any information on the whereabouts of the suspect. The incident took place on Sunday, June 5.

325.title: South makes mass content, north makes class content: Jay Shewakramani
325.article_body: Producer Jay Shewakramani has commented on the north-south cinema debate, saying that south cinema makes mass content while Hindi filmmakers cater to class audience. He further said, "If one wants to do outstanding numbers in Hindi, we need to meet the demands of both spectrums." Jay added 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' is a perfect example of Hindi cinema acing this balance.

326.title: UP CM wants to create state where people feel safe: BJP leader
326.article_body: BJP leader Ashok Bajpai said CM Yogi Adityanath has made constant efforts against criminals in UP. "CM wants to create a state where the rule of law will prevail and people of every society feel safe and secure," Bajpai added. Action is being taken against criminals at district level so that UP can become a crime-free state, he stated.

327.title: Mumbai woman asked to repay ₹3,000 loan, her morphed pics circulated
327.article_body: A 22-year-old woman got abusive messages from 14 phone numbers after she was asked to repay a loan of ₹3,000 that she took from an online application. Her morphed pictures were also circulated to people in her contact list. Reports said that the woman had seen an advertisement for the loan application called 'Kreditloan' on YouTube.

328.title: Salman Khan leaves for film's shoot amid death threat, spotted with police security
328.article_body: Salman Khan was on Monday spotted with police security at the Kalina airport in Mumbai, a day after the actor received a death threat letter. Reports suggested that he will be resuming the shoot of his upcoming film. On Monday, Mumbai Police visited Galaxy Apartments, Salman's house in Bandra, and increased the security around the building.

329.title: I'm sad, can't sleep: Djokovic's coach on his French Open loss vs Nadal
329.article_body: Talking about world number one Novak Djokovic's defeat against Rafael Nadal in the French Open 2022 quarter-final, Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic said, "I can't sleep...I am sad." "I am in a funk," added Goran. Nadal defeated world number eight Casper Ruud in the Roland Garros 2022 final. He won the French Open for a record-extending 14th time.

330.title: Amit Shah inaugurates National Tribal Research Institute in Delhi
330.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday inaugurated the National Tribal Research Institute (NTRI) in Delhi. The NTRI will act as the premier national institute for the promotion and preservation of tribal culture and heritage. "We may think it is just another institution, but such institutions have a role in nation-building," Amit Shah said while addressing the inaugural ceremony.

331.title: India ranks lowest among 180 countries in global environment performance index
331.article_body: India occupies the last spot in the 2022 Environmental Performance Index released recently based on an analysis by Yale and Columbia University researchers. The Index ranked 180 countries using 40 indicators of environmental health. Pakistan and Bangladesh were also among the bottom 10 countries in 176th and 177th spots, respectively. Nepal, Sri Lanka secured 162nd and 132nd ranks, respectively.

332.title: People didn't recognise me at 'Janhit Mein Jaari' screening: Nushrratt
332.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha stated that she isn't successful, adding people didn't recognise her at the screening of her film 'Janhit Mein Jaari'. "I went for a show last night and I had to say that I am Nushrratt Bharuccha," she added. Nushrratt further said that she has yet to reach the stage where people go to theatres to watch her.

333.title: India became global superpower in last 8 yrs under PM Modi: Harsh Vardhan
333.article_body: PM Modi has transformed India from a third-world country into a global superpower in the last eight years, said former Union Minister Harsh Vardhan. "It's only because of [PM's] people-centric policies that people have renewed their faith in democracy," Vardhan said on Tuesday. He further claimed that India is well poised to become the world's third-largest economy by 2030.

334.title: 24 K'taka college students banned for 7 days from classes over hijab
334.article_body: As many as 24 students have been banned for seven days from attending classes in Karnataka's Government First Grade College, Uppinangady in Dakshina Kannada district for wearing hijab, as per college authorities. The students allegedly refused to attend classes without taking off their hijab. This comes almost a week after six students were suspended for wearing hijab.

335.title: Heavy rains, floods affect over 8 lakh people in China
335.article_body: Heavy rains and the resulting floods affected more than eight lakh people in China's Jiangxi province. As many as 80 counties of the province were reportedly impacted. According to the authorities, over 76,000 hectares of farmland was damaged, causing an estimated loss of about 1.16 billion yuan. The Level-IV emergency response was lifted on Tuesday after rains subsided.

336.title: PhysicsWallah, founded by a teacher who refused ₹40 cr job from Unacademy, turns unicorn
336.article_body: Edtech firm PhysicsWallah has become India's 101st unicorn after it raised $100 million in its Series A funding, taking the company’s valuation to $1.1 billion. Founded by Prayagraj-based teacher Alakh Pandey, PhysicsWallah began as a YouTube channel by him in 2016. Reportedly, after starting his channel, Pandey also refused a ₹40-crore per annum job offer from Unacademy.

337.title: Armaan Malik collaborates with Ed Sheeran for new version of '2Step'
337.article_body: Singer Armaan Malik has collaborated with British singer Ed Sheeran for the latest version of the latter's song '2Step'. "I'm...excited to be featured on this version of '2step' with Ed Sheeran! He has always been...an inspiration, and I'm a big fan of his music and...songwriting," Armaan stated. "This will be the beginning for...more collaborations of this nature," he added.

338.title: Will shed my blood but never allow division of Bengal: CM Mamata
338.article_body: Amid demands for a separate state carved out of West Bengal, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said she's ready to shed her blood but will never allow a division of the state. "With elections approaching, BJP is fanning the demands of separate statehood, sometimes seeking Gorkhaland and at other times a separate state of North Bengal," she said.

339.title: Maharashtra Police summons Nupur Sharma over remarks on Prophet
339.article_body: The Maharashtra Police has summoned suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma on June 22 for allegedly making derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad during a television debate. Police have asked Sharma to record her statement in connection with her remarks. The Mumbra Police in Maharashtra's Thane district had registered an FIR against Sharma following her remarks.

340.title: Pune's Sarasbaug to get hawker zones amid anti-encroachment drives
340.article_body: Pune's Sarasbaug area will get dedicated zones for hawkers and food stall owners amid ongoing anti-encroachment drives. "At the meeting arranged by hawkers with the municipal commissioner...on Monday, we sought a plan for development of Sarasbaug," NCP’s Ashwini Kadam said. Pune’s civic body will allocate a budget for area in next financial year, Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said.

341.title: Punjab Cong MP gets call threatening 'same fate as Moosewala', security increased
341.article_body: Punjab Congress MP Ravneet Singh Bittu on Tuesday received a call on WhatsApp, saying he would meet the "same fate" as his late party colleague and Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. Bittu's personal security staff have confirmed the receipt of the threat call and his security has reportedly been enhanced.

342.title: Chris Rock not concerned with Jada's remark on reconciliation: Report
342.article_body: Following Jada Pinkett Smith's remark on Chris Rock and Will Smith reconciling after the 2022 Oscars slap incident, Entertainment Tonight has quoted a source reporting that Chris Rock is "not concerned" with it. "He's not concerned with the Smiths at the moment. He's touring and he's preparing for a comedy special," the source was quoted as saying.

343.title: Happy birthday queen: Actress Kangana Ranaut to Ekta Kapoor
343.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, taking to Instagram Stories, wished Ekta Kapoor on her birthday. Kangana shared a picture of Ekta in her story and wrote, "Happy birthday queen." Kareena Kapoor also wished Ekta on her Instagram Stories. On Instagram, Mouni Roy wrote, "Your birthday is always the perfect opportunity for thanking you for always inspiring...being the light you've been in my life."

344.title: Pune airport authority to start cargo facility on 1.75-acre land
344.article_body: Pune International Airport authority has decided to start a cargo facility on the 1.75-acre land. "The Defence Ministry had approved to transfer land in March, the hand over process is remaining," an airport official said. "The ministry is yet to submit its plans. Once we receive the plans, the procedure for land allocation will start," the official added.

345.title: Right-wing activist booked in UP for 'ban Friday prayers' remarks
345.article_body: A case has been registered against Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha national secretary  Annapurna Bharti, alias Pooja Shakun Pandey, in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh for seeking a "ban on  Friday prayers". Additional City Magistrate (First) summoned her with a notice. While replying to the notice, she denied making any provocative statements.

346.title: Over 60 people fall sick after eating food at wedding in Maha
346.article_body: Over 60 people fell sick after eating food at a wedding in Maharashtra's Yavatmal, a medical official said on Tuesday. The guests complained of uneasiness and started throwing up after consuming the food, he added. About 40-45 guests were taken to a hospital in the neighbouring district, while 20-25 were treated at a local health centre.

347.title: I-T portal not hacked, Infosys fixing issue: Govt as site suffers glitch on anniversary
347.article_body: The government said that there was no data breach on the Income Tax e-filing portal after its search option malfunctioned on the first anniversary of its launch. "Infosys has been directed to look into it and...has confirmed that they are resolving the issue on priority," said the Income Tax Department on Twitter.

348.title: British band Queen to drop unreleased Freddie Mercury song in September
348.article_body: An unreleased song by Freddie Mercury, recorded for his rock band Queen's 13th studio album The Miracle, will come out in September this year. Calling the song a "little gem from Freddie", Queen's Roger Taylor said that they had "kind of forgotten" about it. "It's wonderful, actually. It was a real discovery," Taylor further said.

349.title: Foakes is best wicketkeeper in the world: England Test skipper Stokes
349.article_body: Praising Ben Foakes, England Test skipper Ben Stokes said his teammate is "best wicketkeeper in the world". He added that having Foakes behind the stumps gives him and bowlers a lot of confidence. Stokes said bowlers know that nine times out of 10, Foakes is going to take everything that comes to him. Foakes has played 12 Tests so far.

350.title: 8 held for running parking racket near Gurugram's Galleria market
350.article_body: The Haryana Chief Minister's flying squad in a joint raid on Monday held eight people for allegedly running a parking racket near the Galleria market in Gurugram.
