An official from the flying squad said the accused had been running the racket for two months and collected at least ₹20,000-25,000 every day. The area is earmarked for free parking, officials said.

351.title: Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial wristbands put on sale online for over ₹3.8 lakh
351.article_body: Several spectators who attended the defamation trial between Johnny Depp and Amber Heard in US' Virginia are now selling their paper wristbands online for over ₹3.8 lakh. "This is a piece of celebrity culture history," wrote one seller. The jury found that Heard defamed Depp and awarded him $10 million in compensatory damages and $5 million in punitive damages.

352.title: I played French Open with my left foot asleep because of anaesthetic injections: Nadal
352.article_body: Rafael Nadal, who won French Open for the 14th time, revealed that he played Roland Garros 2022 with his left foot asleep. "I played with no feeling in the foot...because of the anaesthetic injections into the nerve," he said. The 36-year-old added that it was "probably" the most unexpected title for him.

353.title: How does the latest Cricket World Cup Super League points table read?
353.article_body: After defeating Zimbabwe by eight wickets in the second ODI, Afghanistan jumped to the third position on the Cricket World Cup Super League points table. The table is being led by Bangladesh, while England are placed second. Zimbabwe are 12th with just three victories. Top-seven ranked teams and World Cup hosts (India) will automatically qualify for 2023 World Cup.

354.title: Juvenile home in UP's GB Nagar overcrowded: Officials
354.article_body: Officials of District Legal Services Authority (DLSA) on Monday observed that the juvenile home in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar is overcrowded. "A total of 142 'children in conflict with law' are detained in the observation home, but the total capacity is 100," juvenile home Superintendent Dharmendra Maurya said. Notably, children from other districts are also being kept at the facility.

355.title: Pitt accuses Jolie of inflicting harm on him by selling her stake in $28 mn wine firm
355.article_body: Brad Pitt has accused his ex-wife Angelina Jolie of trying to intentionally inflict harm on him by damaging the reputation of their jointly owned wine business, Château Miraval which they bought for $28.4 million in 2008. Pitt alleged that Jolie sold her stake to a company while having agreed to never sell their respective stakes without each other's consent.

356.title: Hyd police book BJP MLA for revealing gang-rape victim's identity
356.article_body: Hyderabad police have booked BJP MLA M Raghunandan Rao for allegedly revealing the identity of the 17-year-old gang-rape victim. According to the FIR, the complainant claimed that Rao had addressed a press conference related to the gang-rape case and released videos and pictures which revealed the minor's identity. This may have caused the victim "colossal distress", the complainant also stated.

357.title: Had my first drink with my parents, their friends: Nushrratt Bharuccha
357.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha said she had her first drink with her parents and their friends, adding that her entire family has been very open, progressive and supportive. Nushrratt stated that the conversation on sexual awareness happened in a "very normal" way in her house. Nushrratt will be next seen in 'Janhit Mein Jaari' where she plays a condom salesgirl.

358.title: There never was one like you: Meghana on Chiranjeevi Sarja's death anniversary
358.article_body: Meghana Raj took to Instagram to pen a note remembering her husband, Chiranjeevi Sarja, on his death anniversary. She shared an old picture of herself with Chiranjeevi and wrote, "You and me...for eternity. There never was one like you, and there will be none like you...You, Chiru...the one and only." Chiranjeevi passed away in 2020, after suffering a heart attack.

359.title: Pune woman to attempt non-stop cycling from Leh to Manali in 60 hours
359.article_body: Pune's ace ultra-cyclist Preeti Maske will be attempting a World Ultra Cycling record by pedalling from Leh to Manali within 60 hours. "I am training hard for this Leh-Manali non-stop high-altitude expedition," Preeti said. Reports said that she admitted that the most challenging part of the Leh-Manali expedition is sleep deprivation as it is a continuous, non-stop ride.

360.title: Special intro scene being designed for SRK in Salman’s Tiger 3: Report
360.article_body: A special introduction scene is being designed for Shah Rukh Khan's cameo in Salman Khan-starrer 'Tiger 3', a source close to the development told Pinkvilla. "The details of [the introduction scene] have been kept under wraps for now," the source added. The source stated that Salman will have a chopper-bound entry in Shah Rukh's 'Pathaan'.

361.title: Hardik is extremely valuable for India, can hit sixes anytime: Irfan
361.article_body: Irfan Pathan said Hardik Pandya is "extremely valuable" for Team India and can hit sixes anytime. "He has the ability to finish the game at...death, he can do that batting up the order as well," he added. Hardik, who last played for India in November 2021, has been named in India's 18-member squad for upcoming T20I series against South Africa.

362.title: Arjun replies as man comments he can 'never get in shape', says 'I don't hide behind pic'
362.article_body: Arjun Kapoor replied to an Instagram user after the latter said he can "never get in shape". "So, according to...you, being in shape is just having cuts on...body. The shift in mentality, the ability to show up and push hard...isn't the point of working out, right?" said Arjun. "I don't hide behind a pic of a torso," he added.

363.title: 8 of family killed, 1 injured as SUV collides with truck in Rajasthan
363.article_body: At least eight people of a family were killed and another was injured after the SUV they were travelling in collided head-on with a truck in Rajasthan's Barmer, police said. The victims were going to a wedding and the accident took place when they were only eight kilometres away from their destination, police added. The deceased included two minors.

364.title: Meta appoints Guy Rosen as its chief information security officer
364.article_body: Meta has appointed Guy Rosen as its first Chief Information Security Officer (CISO). In a memo seen by Reuters, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said he had asked Rosen to take on the role. Rosen said he "will continue to oversee and look across the breadth of safety and security risks the people who use our services...face".

365.title: ED seizes assets of Gupta Builders & Promoters in money laundering case
365.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday said it has seized an Audi car, ₹85 lakh in cash and documents during raids against Chandigarh-based Gupta Builders and Promoters in an alleged money laundering case. The builders are accused of cheating investors of ₹325 crore. ED's probe has found that homebuyers' money was used to purchase various personal assets by the firm's directors.

366.title: Google loses defamation case against Australian politician, told to pay $515,000
366.article_body: Google has been ordered to pay $515,000 (around ₹4 crore) to an Australian former lawmaker after losing a defamation case filed by him. An Australian court found that the company intentionally made money from two YouTube videos attacking and mocking John Barilaro, who was the then-deputy premier of New South Wales. They featured a comedian who accused Barilaro of corruption.

367.title: Nick Jonas limps to emergency room over softball injury, video viral
367.article_body: A video going viral on social media shows singer Nick Jonas limping into an emergency room in California's Encino after suffering an injury during a softball game. Nick appeared to be hit in the groin during the game on Sunday and nearly collapsed on the field. His brother Kevin Jonas drove him to the hospital in a Land Rover.

368.title: Cinema is my oxygen, Vikram's success is not just mine but good cinema's: Kamal
368.article_body: The official handle of Raaj Kamal Films International shared a video of actor Kamal Haasan thanking all the film lovers for their support towards his new film 'Vikram'. He said that cinema is his oxygen and the success of 'Vikram' is not just his but also a win for good cinema. He added 'Vikram' has been given success by viewers.

369.title: MVA leaders should contact us for support in RS polls: Owaisi
369.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday said no one from the ruling Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government in Maharashtra has asked them for support in the upcoming elections to six Rajya Sabha seats. "If they want our support, they should contact us," Owaisi added. Meanwhile, Shiv Sena MLC Ambadas Danve said MVA leaders will soon decide on Owaisi's proposal.

370.title: Tripura CM Manik Saha holds door-to-door campaign ahead of bypolls
370.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha held a door-to-door campaign on Tuesday ahead of Assembly bypolls in the state. Saha, who replaced ex-CM Biplab Kumar Deb last month, is contesting bypolls from the Town Bardowali constituency and filed his nomination papers on June 6. Bypolls to Town Bardowali, Agartala, Surma and Jubarajnagar are scheduled to be held on June 23.

371.title: UK journalist & indigenous expert missing in Amazon rainforest
371.article_body: A British journalist and a Brazilian indigenous expert have gone missing while reporting in a remote area of the Amazon rainforest near Brazil's border with Peru. According to rights groups, Dom Phillips, a regular contributor to the Guardian newspaper, and Bruno Pereira had received threats before they went missing. Brazil's federal police and the Navy are searching for the duo.

372.title: 2 YouTube channels booked, blocked for inciting unrest in UP via fake news
372.article_body: A case has been registered against two YouTube channels for allegedly inciting communal agitation by streaming "misleading" news about the imposition of curfew and riots in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, officials said. The channels 'RA Knowledge World' and 'Bareilly Production' have also been blocked. "An attempt was made to disturb the communal situation of the city," a senior police officer said.

373.title: Pune reports 50% rise in COVID-19 cases in one week
373.article_body: Pune has reported a 50% rise in COVID-19 cases in the week from May 30 to June 5. The city saw 538 new infections during this period as compared to 357 cases between May 23 and May 29, as per the health department data. Mumbai, Pune and Thane have the maximum number of COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, it added.

374.title: 'Ardh' shows husband-wife relationship, struggle of common man: Rajpal
374.article_body: Actor Rajpal Yadav has spoken about his upcoming film 'Ardh', saying that it depicts the relationship of a husband and wife and their day-to-day struggle to live a normal life. He further said that the script showcases the struggle of a common man. "There are many people like (my character) Shiva who are struggling for their dreams," the actor added.

375.title: Mumbai's COVID-19 positivity rate exceeds pre-3rd wave figures
375.article_body: The current COVID-19 test positivity rate in Mumbai over the past week has exceeded five times that of December 2021, during the beginning of the third wave. Over the last week, 54,164 tests were conducted in Mumbai and 4,732 people tested positive, taking the positivity rate to 8.7%. Between December 21-27, last year, the positivity rate was recorded at 1.7%.

376.title: Meesho sends legal notice to marketing firm CEO over smear campaign: Report
376.article_body: E-commerce unicorn Meesho has sent a legal notice to the CEO of an influencer marketing company who was allegedly involved in a smear campaign against Meesho on social media, Moneycontrol reported. The cease and desist notice has asked the influencer marketing manager to reveal who he was working for. He has also been asked to take down all defamatory content.

377.title: Police arrest 28-yr-old tenant for robbing landlord's house in Hyderabad
377.article_body: The Nacharam Police along with Malkajgiri Central Crime Station team apprehended a 28-year-old man for allegedly carrying out robbery at his landlord's house in Hyderabad. Police also seized 53.9 tolas of gold ornaments, 166 grams of silver ornaments and cash worth ₹1,50,000. According to police, the accused committed the theft when the victim and her husband were away in Tirupati.

378.title: Man dies as tyre detached from truck hits him in Chennai; video surfaces
378.article_body: A man walking along a road was killed after a tyre detached from a truck hit him in Chennai, with video of the incident surfacing on social media. The incident took place when the man was walking towards his home after buying groceries. The police have detained the truck driver for questioning.

379.title: Anti-encroachment drive carried out on ₹65 cr-land in Greater Noida
379.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) on Monday carried out an anti-encroachment drive on land worth ₹65 crore, officials said. Five bulldozers were used during the drive, which went on for four hours. "People had constructed boundary walls in empty plots covering large portions...The identities of the colony residents are unknown," GNIDA public relations officer said.

380.title: Leopard rescued from well using 'charpai' in Pune; video surfaces
380.article_body: A video of a leopard being rescued from a 45-foot-deep well using a 'charpai' (woven bed) in a village in Pune's Junnar has surfaced online. The rescue operation was conducted by the Maharashtra Forest Department and non-profit Wildlife SOS after villagers found the leopard and informed them. The leopard was released after a few hours of observation, Wildlife SOS said.

381.title: Vidyut's 'Khuda Haafiz 2' gets postponed, will release on July 8
381.article_body: The release date of Vidyut Jammwal and Shivaleeka Oberoi-starrer 'Khuda Haafiz - Chapter II Agni Pariksha' has been postponed and will now release on July 8. Taking to Instagram, Vidyut announced the new release date for the film. The film was initially set to release on June 17. The film is a sequel to the 2020 film 'Khuda Haafiz'.

382.title: Monsoon to arrive in Mumbai by June 11, conditions favourable: IMD
382.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted June 11 as the date of the onset of monsoon in Mumbai and said the conditions have become favourable over the city. "We'll have to wait for it to enter south Konkan and Goa before it reaches Mumbai," an official said. Mumbai is likely to experience a good rainfall post mid-June, he added.

383.title: Finalise deal, fill potholes immediately: HC tells B'luru civic body
383.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Monday ordered Bengaluru's civic body BBMP to finalise its contract with a private firm to fill the potholes across the city immediately. The court order came after BBMP agreed to pay ₹551 per square metre to the company to fix potholes. BBMP has been asked to submit a zone-wise status report within 10 days.

384.title: Panel of lawyers to assist Moosewala's family free of cost: DBA Mansa
384.article_body: The District Bar Association (DBA) of Punjab's Mansa on Tuesday said that a panel of lawyers will legally assist Sidhu Moosewala's family free of cost in his murder case. "We have also presented a resolution that no advocate will represent the accused in the case," DBA added. Moosewala was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Mansa on May 29.

385.title: Joe Root is England's best ever, now Sachin should watch out: Vaughan
385.article_body: Talking about Joe Root, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said, "Root is England's best ever - now Sachin Tendulkar should watch out." "He could surpass Sachin's record for the most Test runs," added Vaughan. Root recently became the joint-youngest batter to reach 10,000 runs in Tests, overtaking Sachin who reached the mark at the age of 31 years and 326 days.

386.title: Scared to go out for groceries; don't know if we'll be alive: Kashmiri Pandit
386.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit said that the members of the community are scared to go out of homes to buy groceries and medicines. "Offices are closed now...Our children have also stopped going to school because you never know what will happen," the Kashmiri Pandit said, adding, "We see a bleak future for our kids in Kashmir."

387.title: 'Borat...' actress Maria Bakalova to star in 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3'
387.article_body: Maria Bakalova, known for her role in 'Borat Subsequent Moviefilm', is set to star in Marvel Studios' 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3'. Confirming the news on her Instagram handle, the Oscar-nominated actress wrote, "Honestly...I'm the happiest most excited person ever!!!!" The James Gunn directorial, also starring Chris Pratt and Zoe Saldana, is scheduled to release in May 2023.

388.title: British woman raped in front of partner in Goa; accused arrested
388.article_body: A British woman visiting Goa was allegedly raped in front of her male partner at Sweet Water Lake near Arambol beach. The incident occurred on June 2. The accused, a 32-year-old local identified as Joel Vincent D'Souza, allegedly raped the middle-aged woman on the pretext of giving her a massage. D'Souza has been arrested, said police.

389.title: B'desh depot fire that killed 41 brought under control after 3 days
389.article_body: A fire that left 41 people dead at a container depot in Bangladesh's Chittagong has been brought under control after three days, an official said on Tuesday. "The fire hasn't been put out completely but there's no risk of further explosion," fire service official Monir Hossain told Reuters. Authorities suspect a container of hydrogen peroxide was the source of disaster.

390.title: India doesn’t need lecture from any nation on religious tolerance: Cong leader
390.article_body: Following ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Congress' Jaiveer Shergill said India doesn't need a lecture from any nation on religious tolerance. "BJP must realise that our secular identity shouldn't be dented for cheap political gains and TRP sensationalism...India's identity as vibrant, multi cultural habitat must stay forever!" Shergill tweeted.

391.title: There was no one to share the journey with for me back then: Jay Sean
391.article_body: Singer Jay Sean has stated that his journey in the music industry has been a "beautiful one" and added that he has accomplished "a lot" through the years. He added, "There just wasn't anyone to share the journey with for me back then...I often felt alone out there without a peer network or support system."

392.title: The craziest, weirdest blockbuster I've ever seen: Doctor Strange writer on RRR
392.article_body: American screenwriter C Robert Cargill, who penned Benedict Cumberbatch starrer film 'Doctor Strange', took to Twitter to praise SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'. "Friends came over last night to initiate me into the cult of RRR...and I'm here to report I'm now fully, truly, deeply a member," Cargill wrote, adding, "This is the craziest, most sincere, weirdest blockbuster I've ever seen."

393.title: I do see myself taking more playback singing opportunities: Aparshakti
393.article_body: Actor Aparshakti Khurana said he does see himself taking more playback singing opportunities in future, however, while having a "dedicated" acting career. "I'm still...new to music...I'm...three songs old...the love I have received for all three of the songs has been overwhelming, to say the least," he stated. "I love singing...as much as I move along and watch films," Aparshakti added.

394.title: Fintech startup Rupeek fires nearly 180 employees citing business reassessment
394.article_body: Bengaluru-based fintech startup Rupeek has fired 10-15% of its employees as the company reassess its business structure. While the firm didn’t mention the exact number of affected employees, it reportedly has a total of 1,200 employees and nearly 180 are estimated to have been fired. "Subdued macroeconomic environment...compelled us to re-calibrate our strategy, relook at our costs," Rupeek said.

395.title: As expected, SRK didn't even thank me for supporting Aryan: Shatrughan on drugs case
395.article_body: Talking about supporting Aryan Khan in drugs case, actor Shatrughan Sinha said, "As expected...I didn’t receive a thank you card from Shah Rukh Khan." He further said he was "maybe" the most prominent voice standing up for Aryan. "SRK should've gotten in touch with me. But, to be fair to him, he didn’t ask me for support either," Shatrughan stated.

396.title: List of achievements of PM Modi-led govt in 8 years shared by Harsh Goenka
396.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka shared a list of achievements of PM Narendra Modi-led government in eight years. The list showed how India climbed up in ranking in various fields such as automobile production, steel production, mobile phone production, and global innovation index. Goenka mentioned the source of the data as Bloomberg, MSCI, IMF and Kotak MF.

397.title: Sri Lanka needs $5 billion in 6 months for essentials: PM Wickremesinghe
397.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said the government will need at least $5 billion in the next six months to maintain basic standards of living, including some $3.3 billion for fuel imports. "Only establishing economic stability isn't enough, we have to restructure the entire economy," Wickremesinghe, who's preparing an interim budget to balance Sri Lanka's battered public finances, said.

398.title: Not important: Kerala Guv on Qatar's demand for apology over Prophet remarks
398.article_body: As Qatar sought the Indian government’s apology over former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said that "it is not important". "People are entitled to their opinions. How does it matter? That (demand for apology) is not important," Khan added. "India cannot bother about such small reactions," he stated.

399.title: Jaffer was my favourite player, placed him above other legends: Hardik
399.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya said former Team India opener Wasim Jaffer was his favourite cricketer while growing up. "I used to love watching him bat. [He was] someone I always placed...above other legends," added Hardik. "I used to copy his batting but I was never able to get his class," stated Hardik. Jaffer played 31 Tests for Team India.

400.title: Security cover provided to ex-BJP leader after rape threats over remarks on Prophet
400.article_body: The Delhi Police has provided security cover for former BJP leader Nupur Sharma and her family after she received rape and death threats over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad. The Delhi Police has also sent a notice to Twitter to join the investigation and help the police. The BJP on Sunday suspended Sharma over her controversial comments.

401.title: Didn't request ₹500 ticket cost, those making remarks about me lack logic: Nani
401.article_body: Ahead of release of his film 'Ante Sundaraniki', actor Nani said that he did not ask for a ticket price of ₹500 and that those making "disparaging" remarks about him due to ticket pricing "lack basic logic". "They mash up things...Somebody will say something...others will copy it...I simply stated...industry cannot survive on...pricing model of ₹20, 40 and 60," he added.
